  PATIENCE, 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
TIENCE, woman to Queen Katharine
       Shows; Women attending upon the Queen; Scribes,
       Officers, Guards, and other Attendants; Spirits
                          SCENE:
              London; Westminster; Kimbolton
                 KING HENRY THE EIGHTH
                     THE PROLOGUE.
    I come no more to make you laugh; things now
    That bear a weighty and a serious brow,
    Sad, high, and working, full of state and woe,
    Such noble scenes as draw the eye to flow,
    We now present. Those that can pity here
    May, if they think it well, let fall a tear:
    The subject will deserve it. Such as give
    Their money out of hope they may believe
    May here find truth too. Those that come to see
    Only a show or two, and so agree
    The play may pass, if they be still and willing,
    I'll undertake may see away their shilling
    Richly in two short hours. Only they
    That come to hear a merry bawdy play,
    A noise of targets, or to see a fellow
    In a long motley coat guarded with yellow,
    Will be deceiv'd; for, gentle hearers, know,
    To rank our chosen truth with such a show
    As fool and fight is, beside forfeiting
    Our own brains, and the opinion that we bring
    To make that only true we now intend,
    Will leave us never an understanding friend.
    Therefore, for goodness sake, and as you are known
    The first and happiest hearers of the town,
    Be sad, as we would make ye. Think ye see
    The very persons of our noble story
    As they were living; think you see them great,
    And follow'd with the general throng and sweat
    Of thousand friends; then, in a moment, see
    How soon this mightiness meets misery.
    And if you can be merry then, I'll say
    A man may weep upon his wedding-day.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Good morrow, and well met. How have ye done
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. I thank your Grace,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. An untimely ague
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. 'Twixt Guynes and Arde-
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. All the whole time
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Then you lost
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. O, you go far!
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. As I belong to worship, and affect
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Who did guide-
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. One, certes, that promises no element
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. I pray you, who, my lord?
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. All this was ord'red by the good discretion
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. The devil speed him! No man's pie is freed
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Surely, sir,
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. I cannot tell
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Why the devil,
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. I do know
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. O, many
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Grievingly I think
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Every man,
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Which is budded out;
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. Is it therefore
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Marry, is't.
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. A proper tide of a peace, and purchas'd
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Why, all this business
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Like it your Grace,
  NORFOLK. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Like it your Grace,
    The state takes notice of the private difference
    Betwixt you and the Cardinal. I advise you-
    And take it from a heart that wishes towards you
    Honour and plenteous safety-that you read
    The Cardinal's malice and his potency
    Together; to consider further, that
    What his high hatred would effect wants not
    A minister in his power. You know his nature,
    That he's revengeful; and I know his sword
    Hath a sharp edge-it's long and't may be said
    It reaches far, and where 'twill not extend,
    Thither he darts it. Bosom up my counsel
    You'll find it wholesome. Lo, where comes that rock
    That I advise your shunning.
  WOLSEY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
LSEY. The Duke of Buckingham's surveyor? Ha!
  SECRETARY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CRETARY. Here, so please you.
  WOLSEY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
LSEY. Is he in person ready?
  SECRETARY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CRETARY. Ay, please your Grace.
  WOLSEY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
LSEY. Well, we shall then know more, and Buckingham
  WOLSEY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
LSEY. Well, we shall then know more, and Buckingham
    shall lessen this big look.
                                          Exeunt WOLSEY and his train
  BUCKINGHAM.

CARDINAL WOLSEY

  NORFOLK.

  NORFOLK.

CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. No, not a syllable:
    I do pronounce him in that very shape
    He shall appear in proof.
  BRANDON.

  BUCKINGHAM. 
4
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
KING HENRY
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. My surveyor is false. The o'er-great Cardinal
    Hath show'd him gold; my life is spann'd already.
    I am the shadow of poor Buckingham,
    Whose figure even this instant cloud puts on
    By dark'ning my clear sun. My lord, farewell.
    Exeunt
  KING. 
4
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
KING HENRY
BRANDON
NG. My life itself, and the best heart of it,
  KING. 
5
CARDINAL WOLSEY
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
KING HENRY
BRANDON
NG. My life itself, and the best heart of it,
    Thanks you for this great care; I stood i' th' level
    Of a full-charg'd confederacy, and give thanks
    To you that chok'd it. Let be call'd before us
    That gentleman of Buckingham's. In person
    I'll hear his confessions justify;
    And point by point the treasons of his master
    He shall again relate.
      A noise within, crying 'Room for the Queen!'
  QUEEN 
5
CARDINAL WOLSEY
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
KING HENRY
BRANDON

  KING.

6
CARDINAL WOLSEY
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
LSEY. [Aside to the SECRETARY]  A word with you.
    Let there be letters writ to every shire
    Of the King's grace and pardon. The grieved commons
    Hardly conceive of me-let it be nois'd
    That through our intercession this revokement
    And pardon comes. I shall anon advise you
    Further in the proceeding.                         Exit SECRETARY
  QUEEN

CARDINAL WOLSEY
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
NG. There's his period,
    To sheath his knife in us. He is attach'd;
    Call him to present trial. If he may
    Find mercy in the law, 'tis his; if none,
    Let him not seek't of us. By day and night!
    He's traitor to th' height.                                Exeunt
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
7

SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN

    Their clothes are after such a pagan cut to't,
    That sure th' have worn out Christendom.
  LOVELL.

CARDINAL WOLSEY

DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
VELL. Ay, marry,
  SANDYS. 
8
CARDINAL WOLSEY
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
NDYS. The devil fiddle 'em! I am glad they are going,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
8
CARDINAL WOLSEY
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. Well said, Lord Sandys;
  SANDYS.

10
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
NDYS. I am your lordship's.                                Exeunt
  GUILDFORD. 
10
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
ILDFORD. Ladies, a general welcome from his Grace
  GUILDFORD. 
10
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
ILDFORD. Ladies, a general welcome from his Grace
    Salutes ye all; this night he dedicates
    To fair content and you. None here, he hopes,
    In all this noble bevy, has brought with her
    One care abroad; he would have all as merry
    As, first, good company, good wine, good welcome,
    Can make good people.
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
10
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. You are young, Sir Harry Guildford.
  SANDYS. 
10
CARDINAL WOLSEY

  LOVELL.

10
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN

DUKE OF NORFOLK

SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. What warlike voice,
  WOLSEY. 
11
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. What warlike voice,
    And to what end, is this? Nay, ladies, fear not:
    By all the laws of war y'are privileg'd.
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
11
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. How now! what is't?
  SERVANT. 
11
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
RVANT. A noble troop of strangers-
  WOLSEY. 
11
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. Good Lord Chamberlain,
  WOLSEY. 
11
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. Good Lord Chamberlain,
    Go, give 'em welcome; you can speak the French tongue;
    And pray receive 'em nobly and conduct 'em
    Into our presence, where this heaven of beauty
    Shall shine at full upon them. Some attend him.
              Exit CHAMBERLAIN attended. All rise, and tables remov'd
  WOLSEY. 
12
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. Good Lord Chamberlain,
    Go, give 'em welcome; you can speak the French tongue;
    And pray receive 'em nobly and conduct 'em
    Into our presence, where this heaven of beauty
    Shall shine at full upon them. Some attend him.
              Exit CHAMBERLAIN attended. All rise, and tables remov'd
    You have now a broken banquet, but we'll mend it.
    A good digestion to you all; and once more
    I show'r a welcome on ye; welcome all.
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
12
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT

SIR HENRY GUILDFORD

SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. Because they speak no English, thus they pray'd
  WOLSEY.

12
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
NG. Lead in your ladies, ev'ry one. Sweet partner,
  KING. 
13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
NG. Lead in your ladies, ev'ry one. Sweet partner,
    I must not yet forsake you. Let's be merry:
    Good my Lord Cardinal, I have half a dozen healths
    To drink to these fair ladies, and a measure
    To lead 'em once again; and then let's dream
    Who's best in favour. Let the music knock it.
                                                Exeunt, with trumpets
  FIRST 
13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
RST GENTLEMAN. Whither away so fast?
  SECOND 
13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN

LORD CHAMBERLAIN
COND GENTLEMAN. O, God save ye!
  FIRST

LORD CHAMBERLAIN
COND GENTLEMAN. All the commons
    Hate him perniciously, and, o' my conscience,
    Wish him ten fathom deep: this Duke as much
    They love and dote on; call him bounteous Buckingham,
    The mirror of all courtesy-
  FIRST

14
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
BUCKINGHAM
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
    Let it alone; my state now will but mock me.
    When I came hither I was Lord High Constable
    And Duke of Buckingham; now, poor Edward Bohun.
    Yet I am richer than my base accusers
    That never knew what truth meant; I now seal it;
    And with that blood will make 'em one day groan fort.
    My noble father, Henry of Buckingham,
    Who first rais'd head against usurping Richard,
    Flying for succour to his servant Banister,
    Being distress'd, was by that wretch betray'd
    And without trial fell; God's peace be with him!
    Henry the Seventh succeeding, truly pitying
    My father's loss, like a most royal prince,
    Restor'd me to my honours, and out of ruins
    Made my name once more noble. Now his son,
    Henry the Eighth, life, honour, name, and all
    That made me happy, at one stroke has taken
    For ever from the world. I had my trial,
    And must needs say a noble one; which makes me
    A little happier than my wretched father;
    Yet thus far we are one in fortunes: both
    Fell by our servants, by those men we lov'd most-
    A most unnatural and faithless service.
    Heaven has an end in all. Yet, you that hear me,
    This from a dying man receive as certain:
    Where you are liberal of your loves and counsels,
    Be sure you be not loose; for those you make friends
    And give your hearts to, when they once perceive
    The least rub in your fortunes, fall away
    Like water from ye, never found again
    But where they mean to sink ye. All good people,
    Pray for me! I must now forsake ye; the last hour
    Of my long weary life is come upon me.
    Farewell;
    And when you would say something that is sad,
    Speak how I fell. I have done; and God forgive me!
                                          Exeunt BUCKINGHAM and train
  FIRST

13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. 'My lord,
    'The horses your lordship sent for, with all the care
    had, I saw well chosen, ridden, and furnish'd. They were
    young and handsome, and of the best breed in the north.
    When they were ready to set out for London, a man of
    my Lord Cardinal's, by commission, and main power, took
    'em from me, with this reason: his master would be serv'd
    before a subject, if not before the King; which stopp'd
    our mouths, sir.'
    I fear he will indeed. Well, let him have them.
    He will have all, I think.
  NORFOLK.

NG.  [To NORFOLK and SUFFOLK]  We are busy; go.
  NORFOLK.

NG. Ay, and the best she shall have; and my favour
    To him that does best. God forbid else. Cardinal,
    Prithee call Gardiner to me, my new secretary;
    I find him a fit fellow.                              Exit WOLSEY
  WOLSEY.

    The most convenient place that I can think of
    For such receipt of learning is Blackfriars;
    There ye shall meet about this weighty business-
    My Wolsey, see it furnish'd. O, my lord,
    Would it not grieve an able man to leave
    So sweet a bedfellow? But, conscience, conscience!
    O, 'tis a tender place! and I must leave her.              Exeunt
  ANNE.

LORD CHAMBERLAIN
D LADY. In faith, for little England
    You'd venture an emballing. I myself
    Would for Carnarvonshire, although there long'd
    No more to th' crown but that. Lo, who comes here?
  CHAMBERLAIN.

ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
LSEY. Your pleasure, madam?
  QUEEN

  WOLSEY.

IER. Katharine Queen of England, come into the court.
  GENTLEMAN 
14
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT

DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD

VERGERS
NTLEMAN USHER. Madam, you are call'd back.
  QUEEN 
14
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. What need you note it? Pray you keep your way;
  QUEEN 
13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. What need you note it? Pray you keep your way;
    When you are call'd, return. Now the Lord help!
    They vex me past my patience. Pray you pass on.
    I will not tarry; no, nor ever more
    Upon this business my appearance make
    In any of their courts.           Exeunt QUEEN and her attendants
  KING. 
13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
NG. Go thy ways, Kate.
  WOLSEY.

13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
NG.  [Aside]  I may perceive
  KING. 
14
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
NG.  [Aside]  I may perceive
    These cardinals trifle with me. I abhor
    This dilatory sloth and tricks of Rome.
    My learn'd and well-beloved servant, Cranmer,
    Prithee return. With thy approach I know
    My comfort comes along. -Break up the court;
    I say, set on.                   Exuent in manner as they entered
  QUEEN 
14
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. Take thy lute, wench. My soul grows
  QUEEN 
15
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. Take thy lute, wench. My soul grows
      sad with troubles;
    Sing and disperse 'em, if thou canst. Leave working.
                    SONG
        Orpheus with his lute made trees,
        And the mountain tops that freeze,
          Bow themselves when he did sing;
        To his music plants and flowers
        Ever sprung, as sun and showers
          There had made a lasting spring.
        Every thing that heard him play,
        Even the billows of the sea,
          Hung their heads and then lay by.
        In sweet music is such art,
        Killing care and grief of heart
          Fall asleep or hearing die.
  QUEEN 
15
KING

ANNE BULLEN

EEN KATHARINE. How now?
  GENTLEMAN.

14
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. Pray their Graces
    To come near. [Exit GENTLEMAN] What can be their business
  QUEEN 
15
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. Pray their Graces
    To come near. [Exit GENTLEMAN] What can be their business
    With me, a poor weak woman, fall'n from favour?
    I do not like their coming. Now I think on't,
    They should be good men, their affairs as righteous;
    But all hoods make not monks.
  WOLSEY. 
15
KING

LSEY. Peace to your Highness!
  QUEEN

15
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON

WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. Do what ye will my lords; and pray
  QUEEN 
15
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. Do what ye will my lords; and pray
      forgive me
    If I have us'd myself unmannerly;
    You know I am a woman, lacking wit
    To make a seemly answer to such persons.
    Pray do my service to his Majesty;
    He has my heart yet, and shall have my prayers
    While I shall have my life. Come, reverend fathers,
    Bestow your counsels on me; she now begs
    That little thought, when she set footing here,
    She should have bought her dignities so dear.              Exeunt
  NORFOLK. 
15
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
RFOLK. If you will now unite in your complaints
  SURREY.

RREY. I am joyful
  SUFFOLK.

KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
AMBERLAIN. My lords, you speak your pleasures.
  NORFOLK.

14
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
NG. 'Tis nobly spoken.
    Take notice, lords, he has a loyal breast,
    For you have seen him open 't. Read o'er this;
                                                  [Giving him papers]
    And after, this; and then to breakfast with
    What appetite you have.
                Exit the KING, frowning upon the CARDINAL; the NOBLES
  WOLSEY. 
14
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
LSEY. What should this mean?
  WOLSEY. 
14
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
LSEY. What should this mean?
    What sudden anger's this? How have I reap'd it?
    He parted frowning from me, as if ruin
    Leap'd from his eyes; so looks the chafed lion
    Upon the daring huntsman that has gall'd him-
    Then makes him nothing. I must read this paper;
    I fear, the story of his anger. 'Tis so;
    This paper has undone me. 'Tis th' account
    Of all that world of wealth I have drawn together
    For mine own ends; indeed to gain the popedom,
    And fee my friends in Rome. O negligence,
    Fit for a fool to fall by! What cross devil
    Made me put this main secret in the packet
    I sent the King? Is there no way to cure this?
    No new device to beat this from his brains?
    I know 'twill stir him strongly; yet I know
    A way, if it take right, in spite of fortune,
    Will bring me off again. What's this? 'To th' Pope.'
    The letter, as I live, with all the business
    I writ to's Holiness. Nay then, farewell!
    I have touch'd the highest point of all my greatness,
    And from that full meridian of my glory
    I haste now to my setting. I shall fall
    Like a bright exhalation in the evening,
    And no man see me more.
  NORFOLK. 
14
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK

13
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
VERGERS
RFOLK. And so we'll leave you to your meditations
    How to live better. For your stubborn answer
    About the giving back the great seal to us,
    The King shall know it, and, no doubt, shall thank you.
    So fare you well, my little good Lord Cardinal.
                                                Exeunt all but WOLSEY
  WOLSEY. 
13
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
VERGERS
LSEY. So farewell to the little good you bear me.
  WOLSEY. 
14
CROMWELL
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
VERGERS
LSEY. So farewell to the little good you bear me.
    Farewell, a long farewell, to all my greatness!
    This is the state of man: to-day he puts forth
    The tender leaves of hopes; to-morrow blossoms
    And bears his blushing honours thick upon him;
    The third day comes a frost, a killing frost,
    And when he thinks, good easy man, full surely
    His greatness is a-ripening, nips his root,
    And then he falls, as I do. I have ventur'd,
    Like little wanton boys that swim on bladders,
    This many summers in a sea of glory;
    But far beyond my depth. My high-blown pride
    At length broke under me, and now has left me,
    Weary and old with service, to the mercy
    Of a rude stream, that must for ever hide me.
    Vain pomp and glory of this world, I hate ye;
    I feel my heart new open'd. O, how wretched
    Is that poor man that hangs on princes' favours!
    There is betwixt that smile we would aspire to,
    That sweet aspect of princes, and their ruin
    More pangs and fears than wars or women have;
    And when he falls, he falls like Lucifer,
    Never to hope again.
  CROMWELL. 
14
CROMWELL

KING HENRY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
VERGERS
PUCIUS. Madam, in good health.
  KATHARINE. 
17
CROMWELL
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN

  PATIENCE.

CROMWELL
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN

  KATHARINE. 
18
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
GARDINER
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
THARINE. I thank you, honest lord. Remember me
    In all humility unto his Highness;
    Say his long trouble now is passing
    Out of this world. Tell him in death I bless'd him,
    For so I will. Mine eyes grow dim. Farewell,
    My lord. Griffith, farewell. Nay, Patience,
    You must not leave me yet. I must to bed;
    Call in more women. When I am dead, good wench,
    Let me be us'd with honour; strew me over
    With maiden flowers, that all the world may know
    I was a chaste wife to my grave. Embalm me,
    Then lay me forth; although unqueen'd, yet like
    A queen, and daughter to a king, inter me.
    I can no more.                          Exeunt, leading KATHARINE
  GARDINER. 
18

ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANMER. God and your Majesty
  KING. 
20
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
NG. Be of good cheer;
  KING. 
20
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
NG. Be of good cheer;
    They shall no more prevail than we give way to.
    Keep comfort to you, and this morning see
    You do appear before them; if they shall chance,
    In charging you with matters, to commit you,
    The best persuasions to the contrary
    Fail not to use, and with what vehemency
    Th' occasion shall instruct you. If entreaties
    Will render you no remedy, this ring
    Deliver them, and your appeal to us
    There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!
    He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest Mother!
    I swear he is true-hearted, and a soul
    None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,
    And do as I have bid you.
                                                         Exit CRANMER
  KING. 
21
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN

SIR ANTHONY DENNY

DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
NG. Be of good cheer;
    They shall no more prevail than we give way to.
    Keep comfort to you, and this morning see
    You do appear before them; if they shall chance,
    In charging you with matters, to commit you,
    The best persuasions to the contrary
    Fail not to use, and with what vehemency
    Th' occasion shall instruct you. If entreaties
    Will render you no remedy, this ring
    Deliver them, and your appeal to us
    There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!
    He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest Mother!
    I swear he is true-hearted, and a soul
    None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,
    And do as I have bid you.
                                                         Exit CRANMER
    He has strangled his language in his tears.
  GENTLEMAN.

23
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
CRANMER
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
LOVELL
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
D LADY. An hundred marks? By this light, I'll ha' more!
    An ordinary groom is for such payment.
    I will have more, or scold it out of him.
    Said I for this the girl was like to him! I'll
    Have more, or else unsay't; and now, while 'tis hot,
    I'll put it to the issue.                                  Exeunt
  CRANMER.

DENNY

QUEEN
LOVELL
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANMER. I hope I am not too late; and yet the gentleman
    That was sent to me from the Council pray'd me
    To make great haste. All fast? What means this? Ho!
    Who waits there? Sure you know me?
  KEEPER.

25
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
CRANMER
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
KEEPER
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
LOVELL
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
DOCTOR BUTTS
ANMER.  [Aside]  'Tis Butts,
    The King's physician; as he pass'd along,
    How earnestly he cast his eyes upon me!
    Pray heaven he sound not my disgrace! For certain,
    This is of purpose laid by some that hate me-
    God turn their hearts! I never sought their malice-
    To quench mine honour; they would shame to make me
    Wait else at door, a fellow councillor,
    'Mong boys, grooms, and lackeys. But their pleasures
    Must be fulfill'd, and I attend with patience.
  BUTTS.

26
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
CRANMER
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
KEEPER
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
LOVELL
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHANCELLOR
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
DOCTOR BUTTS
NG. Ha, 'tis he indeed.
    Is this the honour they do one another?
    'Tis well there's one above 'em yet. I had thought
    They had parted so much honesty among 'em-
    At least good manners-as not thus to suffer
    A man of his place, and so near our favour,
    To dance attendance on their lordships' pleasures,
    And at the door too, like a post with packets.
    By holy Mary, Butts, there's knavery!
    Let 'em alone, and draw the curtain close;
    We shall hear more anon.                                   Exeunt
  CHANCELLOR.

  CROMWELL.

KATHARINE
DOCTOR BUTTS
OMWELL. My mind gave me,
    In seeking tales and informations
    Against this man-whose honesty the devil
    And his disciples only envy at-
    Ye blew the fire that burns ye. Now have at ye!
  GARDINER.

27
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
PORTER
CRANMER
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
KEEPER
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
LOVELL
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHANCELLOR
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
DOCTOR BUTTS
NG. Good man, those joyful tears show thy true heart.
    The common voice, I see, is verified
    Of thee, which says thus: 'Do my Lord of Canterbury
    A shrewd turn and he's your friend for ever.'
    Come, lords, we trifle time away; I long
    To have this young one made a Christian.
    As I have made ye one, lords, one remain;
    So I grow stronger, you more honour gain.                  Exeunt
  PORTER. 
27
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS

ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
LOVELL
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHANCELLOR
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
DOCTOR BUTTS
RTER. These are the youths that thunder at a playhouse
    and fight for bitten apples; that no audience but the tribulation
    of Tower-hill or the limbs of Limehouse, their dear
    brothers, are able to endure. I have some of 'em in Limbo
    Patrum, and there they are like to dance these three days;
    besides the running banquet of two beadles that is to come.
  CHAMBERLAIN.

 OLD LADY, friend to Anne Bullen
  PATIENCE,

TIENCE, woman to Queen Katharine
  PATIENCE, 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
TIENCE, woman to Queen Katharine
       Shows; Women attending upon the Queen; Scribes,
       Officers, Guards, and other Attendants; Spirits
                          SCENE:
              London; Westminster; Kimbolton
                 KING HENRY THE EIGHTH
                     THE PROLOGUE.
    I come no more to make you laugh; things now
    That bear a weighty and a serious brow,
    Sad, high, and working, full of state and woe,
    Such noble scenes as draw the eye to flow,
    We now present. Those that can pity here
    May, if they think it well, let fall a tear:
    The subject will deserve it. Such as give
    Their money out of hope they may believe
    May here find truth too. Those that come to see
    Only a show or two, and so agree
    The play may pass, if they be still and willing,
    I'll undertake may see away their shilling
    Richly in two short hours. Only they
    That come to hear a merry bawdy play,
    A noise of targets, or to see a fellow
    In a long motley coat guarded with yellow,
    Will be deceiv'd; for, gentle hearers, know,
    To rank our chosen truth with such a show
    As fool and fight is, beside forfeiting
    Our own brains, and the opinion that we bring
    To make that only true we now intend,
    Will leave us never an understanding friend.
    Therefore, for goodness sake, and as you are known
    The first and happiest hearers of the town,
    Be sad, as we would make ye. Think ye see
    The very persons of our noble story
    As they were living; think you see them great,
    And follow'd with the general throng and sweat
    Of thousand friends; then, in a moment, see
    How soon this mightiness meets misery.
    And if you can be merry then, I'll say
    A man may weep upon his wedding-day.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Good morrow, and well met. How have ye done
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. I thank your Grace,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. An untimely ague
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. 'Twixt Guynes and Arde-
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. All the whole time
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Then you lost
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. O, you go far!
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. As I belong to worship, and affect
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Who did guide-
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. One, certes, that promises no element
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. I pray you, who, my lord?
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. All this was ord'red by the good discretion
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. The devil speed him! No man's pie is freed
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Surely, sir,
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. I cannot tell
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Why the devil,
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. I do know
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. O, many
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Grievingly I think
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Every man,
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Which is budded out;
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. Is it therefore
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Marry, is't.
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. A proper tide of a peace, and purchas'd
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Why, all this business
  NORFOLK. 
1
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Like it your Grace,
  NORFOLK. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Like it your Grace,
    The state takes notice of the private difference
    Betwixt you and the Cardinal. I advise you-
    And take it from a heart that wishes towards you
    Honour and plenteous safety-that you read
    The Cardinal's malice and his potency
    Together; to consider further, that
    What his high hatred would effect wants not
    A minister in his power. You know his nature,
    That he's revengeful; and I know his sword
    Hath a sharp edge-it's long and't may be said
    It reaches far, and where 'twill not extend,
    Thither he darts it. Bosom up my counsel
    You'll find it wholesome. Lo, where comes that rock
    That I advise your shunning.
  WOLSEY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
LSEY. The Duke of Buckingham's surveyor? Ha!
  SECRETARY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CRETARY. Here, so please you.
  WOLSEY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
LSEY. Is he in person ready?
  SECRETARY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CRETARY. Ay, please your Grace.
  WOLSEY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
LSEY. Well, we shall then know more, and Buckingham
  WOLSEY. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
LSEY. Well, we shall then know more, and Buckingham
    shall lessen this big look.
                                          Exeunt WOLSEY and his train
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. This butcher's cur is venom-mouth'd, and I
  NORFOLK. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. What, are you chaf'd?
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. I read in's looks
  NORFOLK. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Stay, my lord,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. I'll to the King,
  NORFOLK. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Be advis'd:
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Sir,
  NORFOLK. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Say not treasonous.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. To th' King I'll say't, and make my vouch as strong
  NORFOLK. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. Faith, and so it did.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Pray, give me favour, sir; this cunning cardinal
  NORFOLK. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
RFOLK. I am sorry
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. No, not a syllable:
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. No, not a syllable:
    I do pronounce him in that very shape
    He shall appear in proof.
  BRANDON. 
3
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. Your office, sergeant: execute it.
  SERGEANT.

BRANDON

  BUCKINGHAM.

DUKE OF NORFOLK

  BRANDON.

DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. I am sorry
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. It will help nothing
  BRANDON. 
3
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. Nay, he must bear you company.
  ABERGAVENNY.

DUKE OF NORFOLK

ERGAVENNY. As the Duke said,
  BRANDON.

DUKE OF NORFOLK

  BUCKINGHAM.

DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. So, so!
  BRANDON. 
3
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. A monk o' th' Chartreux.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. O, Nicholas Hopkins?
  BRANDON. 
3
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. He.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. My surveyor is false. The o'er-great Cardinal
  BUCKINGHAM. 
4
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
KING HENRY
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. My surveyor is false. The o'er-great Cardinal
    Hath show'd him gold; my life is spann'd already.
    I am the shadow of poor Buckingham,
    Whose figure even this instant cloud puts on
    By dark'ning my clear sun. My lord, farewell.
    Exeunt
  KING. 
4
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
KING HENRY
BRANDON
NG. My life itself, and the best heart of it,
  KING. 
5
CARDINAL WOLSEY
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
KING HENRY
BRANDON
NG. My life itself, and the best heart of it,
    Thanks you for this great care; I stood i' th' level
    Of a full-charg'd confederacy, and give thanks
    To you that chok'd it. Let be call'd before us
    That gentleman of Buckingham's. In person
    I'll hear his confessions justify;
    And point by point the treasons of his master
    He shall again relate.
      A noise within, crying 'Room for the Queen!'
  QUEEN 
5
CARDINAL WOLSEY
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
KING HENRY
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. Nay, we must longer kneel: I am suitor.
  KING. 
5
CARDINAL WOLSEY
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
KING HENRY
BRANDON
NG. Arise, and take place by us. Half your suit
  QUEEN

  WOLSEY. 
6
CARDINAL WOLSEY
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
LSEY. [Aside to the SECRETARY]  A word with you.
    Let there be letters writ to every shire
    Of the King's grace and pardon. The grieved commons
    Hardly conceive of me-let it be nois'd
    That through our intercession this revokement
    And pardon comes. I shall anon advise you
    Further in the proceeding.                         Exit SECRETARY
  QUEEN

7
CARDINAL WOLSEY
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
NG. There's his period,
    To sheath his knife in us. He is attach'd;
    Call him to present trial. If he may
    Find mercy in the law, 'tis his; if none,
    Let him not seek't of us. By day and night!
    He's traitor to th' height.                                Exeunt
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
7
CARDINAL WOLSEY

  SANDYS.

SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. Death! my lord,
    Their clothes are after such a pagan cut to't,
    That sure th' have worn out Christendom.
  LOVELL.

CARDINAL WOLSEY

SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN

  GUILDFORD. 
10
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
ILDFORD. Ladies, a general welcome from his Grace
    Salutes ye all; this night he dedicates
    To fair content and you. None here, he hopes,
    In all this noble bevy, has brought with her
    One care abroad; he would have all as merry
    As, first, good company, good wine, good welcome,
    Can make good people.
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
10
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. You are young, Sir Harry Guildford.
  SANDYS.

KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
NDYS. I would I were;
  LOVELL.

  SANDYS.

11
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. What warlike voice,
    And to what end, is this? Nay, ladies, fear not:
    By all the laws of war y'are privileg'd.
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
11
CARDINAL WOLSEY

11
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN

11
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. Good Lord Chamberlain,
    Go, give 'em welcome; you can speak the French tongue;
    And pray receive 'em nobly and conduct 'em
    Into our presence, where this heaven of beauty
    Shall shine at full upon them. Some attend him.
              Exit CHAMBERLAIN attended. All rise, and tables remov'd
  WOLSEY. 
12
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. Good Lord Chamberlain,
    Go, give 'em welcome; you can speak the French tongue;
    And pray receive 'em nobly and conduct 'em
    Into our presence, where this heaven of beauty
    Shall shine at full upon them. Some attend him.
              Exit CHAMBERLAIN attended. All rise, and tables remov'd
    You have now a broken banquet, but we'll mend it.
    A good digestion to you all; and once more
    I show'r a welcome on ye; welcome all.
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
12

13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
NG. Lead in your ladies, ev'ry one. Sweet partner,
    I must not yet forsake you. Let's be merry:
    Good my Lord Cardinal, I have half a dozen healths
    To drink to these fair ladies, and a measure
    To lead 'em once again; and then let's dream
    Who's best in favour. Let the music knock it.
                                                Exeunt, with trumpets
  FIRST

SIR THOMAS LOVELL
BUCKINGHAM
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
COND GENTLEMAN. All the commons
    Hate him perniciously, and, o' my conscience,
    Wish him ten fathom deep: this Duke as much
    They love and dote on; call him bounteous Buckingham,
    The mirror of all courtesy-
  FIRST

14
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT

CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
    Let it alone; my state now will but mock me.
    When I came hither I was Lord High Constable
    And Duke of Buckingham; now, poor Edward Bohun.
    Yet I am richer than my base accusers
    That never knew what truth meant; I now seal it;
    And with that blood will make 'em one day groan fort.
    My noble father, Henry of Buckingham,
    Who first rais'd head against usurping Richard,
    Flying for succour to his servant Banister,
    Being distress'd, was by that wretch betray'd
    And without trial fell; God's peace be with him!
    Henry the Seventh succeeding, truly pitying
    My father's loss, like a most royal prince,
    Restor'd me to my honours, and out of ruins
    Made my name once more noble. Now his son,
    Henry the Eighth, life, honour, name, and all
    That made me happy, at one stroke has taken
    For ever from the world. I had my trial,
    And must needs say a noble one; which makes me
    A little happier than my wretched father;
    Yet thus far we are one in fortunes: both
    Fell by our servants, by those men we lov'd most-
    A most unnatural and faithless service.
    Heaven has an end in all. Yet, you that hear me,
    This from a dying man receive as certain:
    Where you are liberal of your loves and counsels,
    Be sure you be not loose; for those you make friends
    And give your hearts to, when they once perceive
    The least rub in your fortunes, fall away
    Like water from ye, never found again
    But where they mean to sink ye. All good people,
    Pray for me! I must now forsake ye; the last hour
    Of my long weary life is come upon me.
    Farewell;
    And when you would say something that is sad,
    Speak how I fell. I have done; and God forgive me!
                                          Exeunt BUCKINGHAM and train
  FIRST

13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. 'My lord,
    'The horses your lordship sent for, with all the care
    had, I saw well chosen, ridden, and furnish'd. They were
    young and handsome, and of the best breed in the north.
    When they were ready to set out for London, a man of
    my Lord Cardinal's, by commission, and main power, took
    'em from me, with this reason: his master would be serv'd
    before a subject, if not before the King; which stopp'd
    our mouths, sir.'
    I fear he will indeed. Well, let him have them.
    He will have all, I think.
  NORFOLK.

NG. Ay, and the best she shall have; and my favour

    Prithee call Gardiner to me, my new secretary;
    I find him a fit fellow.                              Exit WOLSEY
  WOLSEY.

KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
RDINER.  [Aside to WOLSEY]  But to be commanded
  KING.

  CAMPEIUS.

NG. Deliver this with modesty to th' Queen.
                                                        Exit GARDINER
    The most convenient place that I can think of
    For such receipt of learning is Blackfriars;
    There ye shall meet about this weighty business-
    My Wolsey, see it furnish'd. O, my lord,
    Would it not grieve an able man to leave
    So sweet a bedfellow? But, conscience, conscience!
    O, 'tis a tender place! and I must leave her.              Exeunt
  ANNE.

NE. Not for that neither. Here's the pang that pinches:

KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY

SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
LORD CHAMBERLAIN
D LADY. In faith, for little England
    You'd venture an emballing. I myself
    Would for Carnarvonshire, although there long'd
    No more to th' crown but that. Lo, who comes here?
  CHAMBERLAIN.

KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN

EEN KATHARINE. What need you note it? Pray you keep your way;
  QUEEN 
13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. What need you note it? Pray you keep your way;
    When you are call'd, return. Now the Lord help!
    They vex me past my patience. Pray you pass on.
    I will not tarry; no, nor ever more
    Upon this business my appearance make
    In any of their courts.           Exeunt QUEEN and her attendants
  KING. 
13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
NG. Go thy ways, Kate.
  WOLSEY. 
13
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
LSEY. Most gracious sir,
  KING.

CARDINAL WOLSEY

  KING. 
14
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
NG.  [Aside]  I may perceive
    These cardinals trifle with me. I abhor
    This dilatory sloth and tricks of Rome.
    My learn'd and well-beloved servant, Cranmer,
    Prithee return. With thy approach I know
    My comfort comes along. -Break up the court;
    I say, set on.                   Exuent in manner as they entered
  QUEEN 
14
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. Take thy lute, wench. My soul grows
  QUEEN 
15
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. Take thy lute, wench. My soul grows
      sad with troubles;
    Sing and disperse 'em, if thou canst. Leave working.
                    SONG
        Orpheus with his lute made trees,
        And the mountain tops that freeze,
          Bow themselves when he did sing;
        To his music plants and flowers
        Ever sprung, as sun and showers
          There had made a lasting spring.
        Every thing that heard him play,
        Even the billows of the sea,
          Hung their heads and then lay by.
        In sweet music is such art,
        Killing care and grief of heart
          Fall asleep or hearing die.
  QUEEN 
15
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN

BRANDON

SIR THOMAS LOVELL

EEN KATHARINE. How now?
  GENTLEMAN.

KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. Pray their Graces
    To come near. [Exit GENTLEMAN] What can be their business
  QUEEN 
15
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. Pray their Graces
    To come near. [Exit GENTLEMAN] What can be their business
    With me, a poor weak woman, fall'n from favour?
    I do not like their coming. Now I think on't,
    They should be good men, their affairs as righteous;
    But all hoods make not monks.
  WOLSEY. 
15

  QUEEN 
15
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
EEN KATHARINE. Do what ye will my lords; and pray
      forgive me
    If I have us'd myself unmannerly;
    You know I am a woman, lacking wit
    To make a seemly answer to such persons.
    Pray do my service to his Majesty;
    He has my heart yet, and shall have my prayers
    While I shall have my life. Come, reverend fathers,
    Bestow your counsels on me; she now begs
    That little thought, when she set footing here,
    She should have bought her dignities so dear.              Exeunt
  NORFOLK. 
15

RFOLK. If you will now unite in your complaints

CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
NG. 'Tis nobly spoken.
    Take notice, lords, he has a loyal breast,
    For you have seen him open 't. Read o'er this;
                                                  [Giving him papers]
    And after, this; and then to breakfast with
    What appetite you have.
                Exit the KING, frowning upon the CARDINAL; the NOBLES
  WOLSEY. 
14
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
LSEY. What should this mean?
  WOLSEY. 
14
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
LSEY. What should this mean?
    What sudden anger's this? How have I reap'd it?
    He parted frowning from me, as if ruin
    Leap'd from his eyes; so looks the chafed lion
    Upon the daring huntsman that has gall'd him-
    Then makes him nothing. I must read this paper;
    I fear, the story of his anger. 'Tis so;
    This paper has undone me. 'Tis th' account
    Of all that world of wealth I have drawn together
    For mine own ends; indeed to gain the popedom,
    And fee my friends in Rome. O negligence,
    Fit for a fool to fall by! What cross devil
    Made me put this main secret in the packet
    I sent the King? Is there no way to cure this?
    No new device to beat this from his brains?
    I know 'twill stir him strongly; yet I know
    A way, if it take right, in spite of fortune,
    Will bring me off again. What's this? 'To th' Pope.'
    The letter, as I live, with all the business
    I writ to's Holiness. Nay then, farewell!
    I have touch'd the highest point of all my greatness,
    And from that full meridian of my glory
    I haste now to my setting. I shall fall
    Like a bright exhalation in the evening,
    And no man see me more.
  NORFOLK. 
14
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN

SIR HENRY GUILDFORD

BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
WOLSEY
VERGERS
RFOLK. Hear the King's pleasure, Cardinal, who commands you
  WOLSEY.

13
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
VERGERS
RFOLK. And so we'll leave you to your meditations
    How to live better. For your stubborn answer
    About the giving back the great seal to us,
    The King shall know it, and, no doubt, shall thank you.
    So fare you well, my little good Lord Cardinal.
                                                Exeunt all but WOLSEY
  WOLSEY. 
13
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
VERGERS
LSEY. So farewell to the little good you bear me.
  WOLSEY. 
14
CROMWELL
CARDINAL WOLSEY
ANNE BULLEN
SERVANT
QUEEN
DUKE OF NORFOLK
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
CARDINALS
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
VERGERS
LSEY. So farewell to the little good you bear me.
    Farewell, a long farewell, to all my greatness!
    This is the state of man: to-day he puts forth
    The tender leaves of hopes; to-morrow blossoms
    And bears his blushing honours thick upon him;
    The third day comes a frost, a killing frost,
    And when he thinks, good easy man, full surely
    His greatness is a-ripening, nips his root,
    And then he falls, as I do. I have ventur'd,
    Like little wanton boys that swim on bladders,
    This many summers in a sea of glory;
    But far beyond my depth. My high-blown pride
    At length broke under me, and now has left me,
    Weary and old with service, to the mercy
    Of a rude stream, that must for ever hide me.
    Vain pomp and glory of this world, I hate ye;
    I feel my heart new open'd. O, how wretched
    Is that poor man that hangs on princes' favours!
    There is betwixt that smile we would aspire to,
    That sweet aspect of princes, and their ruin
    More pangs and fears than wars or women have;
    And when he falls, he falls like Lucifer,
    Never to hope again.
  CROMWELL.

CROMWELL

18
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
GARDINER
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
THARINE. I thank you, honest lord. Remember me
    In all humility unto his Highness;
    Say his long trouble now is passing
    Out of this world. Tell him in death I bless'd him,
    For so I will. Mine eyes grow dim. Farewell,
    My lord. Griffith, farewell. Nay, Patience,
    You must not leave me yet. I must to bed;
    Call in more women. When I am dead, good wench,
    Let me be us'd with honour; strew me over
    With maiden flowers, that all the world may know
    I was a chaste wife to my grave. Embalm me,
    Then lay me forth; although unqueen'd, yet like
    A queen, and daughter to a king, inter me.
    I can no more.                          Exeunt, leading KATHARINE
  GARDINER. 
18
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
GARDINER
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
RDINER. It's one o'clock, boy, is't not?
  BOY.

QUEEN

LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
Y. It hath struck.

SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY

CARDINAL WOLSEY

  KING. 
20
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
NG. Be of good cheer;
    They shall no more prevail than we give way to.
    Keep comfort to you, and this morning see
    You do appear before them; if they shall chance,
    In charging you with matters, to commit you,
    The best persuasions to the contrary
    Fail not to use, and with what vehemency
    Th' occasion shall instruct you. If entreaties
    Will render you no remedy, this ring
    Deliver them, and your appeal to us
    There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!
    He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest Mother!
    I swear he is true-hearted, and a soul
    None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,
    And do as I have bid you.
                                                         Exit CRANMER
  KING. 
21
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
NG. Be of good cheer;
    They shall no more prevail than we give way to.
    Keep comfort to you, and this morning see
    You do appear before them; if they shall chance,
    In charging you with matters, to commit you,
    The best persuasions to the contrary
    Fail not to use, and with what vehemency
    Th' occasion shall instruct you. If entreaties
    Will render you no remedy, this ring
    Deliver them, and your appeal to us
    There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!
    He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest Mother!
    I swear he is true-hearted, and a soul
    None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,
    And do as I have bid you.
                                                         Exit CRANMER
    He has strangled his language in his tears.
  GENTLEMAN.

NTLEMAN.  [Within]  Come back; what mean you?
  OLD

23
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
CRANMER
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
LOVELL
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
D LADY. An hundred marks? By this light, I'll ha' more!
    An ordinary groom is for such payment.
    I will have more, or scold it out of him.
    Said I for this the girl was like to him! I'll
    Have more, or else unsay't; and now, while 'tis hot,
    I'll put it to the issue.                                  Exeunt
  CRANMER.

QUEEN
LOVELL
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANMER. I hope I am not too late; and yet the gentleman
    That was sent to me from the Council pray'd me
    To make great haste. All fast? What means this? Ho!
    Who waits there? Sure you know me?
  KEEPER.

25
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
CRANMER
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
KEEPER
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
LOVELL
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
DOCTOR BUTTS
ANMER.  [Aside]  'Tis Butts,
    The King's physician; as he pass'd along,
    How earnestly he cast his eyes upon me!
    Pray heaven he sound not my disgrace! For certain,
    This is of purpose laid by some that hate me-
    God turn their hearts! I never sought their malice-
    To quench mine honour; they would shame to make me
    Wait else at door, a fellow councillor,
    'Mong boys, grooms, and lackeys. But their pleasures
    Must be fulfill'd, and I attend with patience.
  BUTTS.

26
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
CRANMER
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
KEEPER
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
LOVELL
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHANCELLOR
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
DOCTOR BUTTS
NG. Ha, 'tis he indeed.
    Is this the honour they do one another?
    'Tis well there's one above 'em yet. I had thought
    They had parted so much honesty among 'em-
    At least good manners-as not thus to suffer
    A man of his place, and so near our favour,
    To dance attendance on their lordships' pleasures,
    And at the door too, like a post with packets.
    By holy Mary, Butts, there's knavery!
    Let 'em alone, and draw the curtain close;
    We shall hear more anon.                                   Exeunt
  CHANCELLOR.

DOCTOR BUTTS
OMWELL. My mind gave me,
    In seeking tales and informations
    Against this man-whose honesty the devil
    And his disciples only envy at-
    Ye blew the fire that burns ye. Now have at ye!
  GARDINER.

27
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
GENTLEMEN
SIR ANTHONY DENNY
KING
CARDINAL WOLSEY
DUKE OF NORFOLK
CARDINALS
VERGERS
CROMWELL
PORTER
CRANMER
SIR HENRY GUILDFORD
SURVEYOR
KING HENRY
KEEPER
DENNY
ANNE BULLEN
QUEEN
LOVELL
SIR THOMAS LOVELL
LORD CHANCELLOR
OLD LADY
LORD CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
DOCTOR BUTTS
NG. Good man, those joyful tears show thy true heart.
    The common voice, I see, is verified
    Of thee, which says thus: 'Do my Lord of Canterbury
    A shrewd turn and he's your friend for ever.'
    Come, lords, we trifle time away; I long
    To have this young one made a Christian.
    As I have made ye one, lords, one remain;
    So I grow stronger, you more honour gain.                  Exeunt
  PORTER.

RTER. You'll leave your noise anon, ye rascals. Do you
  PORTER.

DOCTOR BUTTS
RTER. These are the youths that thunder at a playhouse
    and fight for bitten apples; that no audience but the tribulation
    of Tower-hill or the limbs of Limehouse, their dear
    brothers, are able to endure. I have some of 'em in Limbo
    Patrum, and there they are like to dance these three days;
    besides the running banquet of two beadles that is to come.
  CHAMBERLAIN.

  PATIENCE,

TIENCE, woman to Queen Katharine
  PATIENCE, 
1
NORFOLK
TIENCE, woman to Queen Katharine
       Shows; Women attending upon the Queen; Scribes,
       Officers, Guards, and other Attendants; Spirits
                          SCENE:
              London; Westminster; Kimbolton
                 KING HENRY THE EIGHTH
                     THE PROLOGUE.
    I come no more to make you laugh; things now
    That bear a weighty and a serious brow,
    Sad, high, and working, full of state and woe,
    Such noble scenes as draw the eye to flow,
    We now present. Those that can pity here
    May, if they think it well, let fall a tear:
    The subject will deserve it. Such as give
    Their money out of hope they may believe
    May here find truth too. Those that come to see
    Only a show or two, and so agree
    The play may pass, if they be still and willing,
    I'll undertake may see away their shilling
    Richly in two short hours. Only they
    That come to hear a merry bawdy play,
    A noise of targets, or to see a fellow
    In a long motley coat guarded with yellow,
    Will be deceiv'd; for, gentle hearers, know,
    To rank our chosen truth with such a show
    As fool and fight is, beside forfeiting
    Our own brains, and the opinion that we bring
    To make that only true we now intend,
    Will leave us never an understanding friend.
    Therefore, for goodness sake, and as you are known
    The first and happiest hearers of the town,
    Be sad, as we would make ye. Think ye see
    The very persons of our noble story
    As they were living; think you see them great,
    And follow'd with the general throng and sweat
    Of thousand friends; then, in a moment, see
    How soon this mightiness meets misery.
    And if you can be merry then, I'll say
    A man may weep upon his wedding-day.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Good morrow, and well met. How have ye done
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. I thank your Grace,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. An untimely ague
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. 'Twixt Guynes and Arde-
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. All the whole time
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Then you lost
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. O, you go far!
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. As I belong to worship, and affect
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Who did guide-
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. One, certes, that promises no element
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. I pray you, who, my lord?
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. All this was ord'red by the good discretion
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. The devil speed him! No man's pie is freed
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Surely, sir,
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. I cannot tell
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Why the devil,
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. I do know
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. O, many
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Grievingly I think
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Every man,
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Which is budded out;
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. Is it therefore
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Marry, is't.
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. A proper tide of a peace, and purchas'd
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Why, all this business
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Like it your Grace,
  NORFOLK. 
2
WOLSEY
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Like it your Grace,
    The state takes notice of the private difference
    Betwixt you and the Cardinal. I advise you-
    And take it from a heart that wishes towards you
    Honour and plenteous safety-that you read
    The Cardinal's malice and his potency
    Together; to consider further, that
    What his high hatred would effect wants not
    A minister in his power. You know his nature,
    That he's revengeful; and I know his sword
    Hath a sharp edge-it's long and't may be said
    It reaches far, and where 'twill not extend,
    Thither he darts it. Bosom up my counsel
    You'll find it wholesome. Lo, where comes that rock
    That I advise your shunning.
  WOLSEY. 
2
WOLSEY
NORFOLK
LSEY. The Duke of Buckingham's surveyor? Ha!
  SECRETARY. 
2
WOLSEY
NORFOLK
CRETARY. Here, so please you.
  WOLSEY. 
2
WOLSEY
NORFOLK
LSEY. Is he in person ready?
  SECRETARY. 
2
WOLSEY
NORFOLK
CRETARY. Ay, please your Grace.
  WOLSEY. 
2
WOLSEY
NORFOLK
LSEY. Well, we shall then know more, and Buckingham
  WOLSEY. 
1
NORFOLK
LSEY. Well, we shall then know more, and Buckingham
    shall lessen this big look.
                                          Exeunt WOLSEY and his train
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. This butcher's cur is venom-mouth'd, and I
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. What, are you chaf'd?
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. I read in's looks
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Stay, my lord,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. I'll to the King,
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Be advis'd:
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Sir,
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Say not treasonous.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. To th' King I'll say't, and make my vouch as strong
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Faith, and so it did.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Pray, give me favour, sir; this cunning cardinal
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. I am sorry
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. No, not a syllable:
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. No, not a syllable:
    I do pronounce him in that very shape
    He shall appear in proof.
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. Your office, sergeant: execute it.
  SERGEANT. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
RGEANT. Sir,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. Lo you, my lord,
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. I am sorry
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. It will help nothing
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. Nay, he must bear you company.
  ABERGAVENNY. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ERGAVENNY. As the Duke said,
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. Here is warrant from
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. So, so!
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. A monk o' th' Chartreux.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. O, Nicholas Hopkins?
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. He.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. My surveyor is false. The o'er-great Cardinal
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. My surveyor is false. The o'er-great Cardinal
    Hath show'd him gold; my life is spann'd already.
    I am the shadow of poor Buckingham,
    Whose figure even this instant cloud puts on
    By dark'ning my clear sun. My lord, farewell.
    Exeunt
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. My life itself, and the best heart of it,
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. My life itself, and the best heart of it,
    Thanks you for this great care; I stood i' th' level
    Of a full-charg'd confederacy, and give thanks
    To you that chok'd it. Let be call'd before us
    That gentleman of Buckingham's. In person
    I'll hear his confessions justify;
    And point by point the treasons of his master
    He shall again relate.
      A noise within, crying 'Room for the Queen!'
  QUEEN 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. Nay, we must longer kneel: I am suitor.
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. Arise, and take place by us. Half your suit
  QUEEN 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. Thank your Majesty.
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. Lady mine, proceed.
  QUEEN 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. I am solicited, not by a few,
  NORFOLK. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
RFOLK. Not almost appears-
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. Taxation!
  WOLSEY. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
LSEY. Please you, sir,
  QUEEN 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. No, my lord!
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. Still exaction!
  QUEEN 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. I am much too venturous
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. By my life,
  WOLSEY. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
LSEY. And for me,
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. Things done well
  WOLSEY. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
LSEY. [Aside to the SECRETARY]  A word with you.
  WOLSEY. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
LSEY. [Aside to the SECRETARY]  A word with you.
    Let there be letters writ to every shire
    Of the King's grace and pardon. The grieved commons
    Hardly conceive of me-let it be nois'd
    That through our intercession this revokement
    And pardon comes. I shall anon advise you
    Further in the proceeding.                         Exit SECRETARY
  QUEEN 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. I am sorry that the Duke of Buckingham
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. It grieves many.
  WOLSEY. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
LSEY. Stand forth, and with bold spirit relate what you,
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. Speak freely.
  SURVEYOR. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
RVEYOR. First, it was usual with him-every day
  WOLSEY. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
LSEY. Please your Highness, note
  QUEEN 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. My learn'd Lord Cardinal,
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. Speak on.
  SURVEYOR. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
RVEYOR. He was brought to this
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. What was that Henton?
  SURVEYOR. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
RVEYOR. Sir, a Chartreux friar,
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. How know'st thou this?
  SURVEYOR. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
RVEYOR. Not long before your Highness sped to France,
  QUEEN 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. If I know you well,
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. Let him on.
  SURVEYOR. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
RVEYOR. On my soul, I'll speak but truth.
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. Ha! what, so rank? Ah ha!
  SURVEYOR. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
RVEYOR. I can, my liege.
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. Proceed.
  SURVEYOR. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
RVEYOR. Being at Greenwich,
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. I remember
  SURVEYOR. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
RVEYOR. 'If' quoth he 'I for this had been committed-
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. A giant traitor!
  WOLSEY. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
LSEY. Now, madam, may his Highness live in freedom,
  QUEEN 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. God mend all!
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. There's something more would out of thee: what say'st?
  SURVEYOR. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
RVEYOR. After 'the Duke his father' with the 'knife,'
  KING. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. There's his period,
  KING. 
5
KING
NORFOLK
CHAMBERLAIN
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. There's his period,
    To sheath his knife in us. He is attach'd;
    Call him to present trial. If he may
    Find mercy in the law, 'tis his; if none,
    Let him not seek't of us. By day and night!
    He's traitor to th' height.                                Exeunt
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
5
KING
NORFOLK
CHAMBERLAIN
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
AMBERLAIN. Is't possible the spells of France should juggle
  SANDYS. 
5
KING
NORFOLK
CHAMBERLAIN
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NDYS. New customs,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
5
KING
NORFOLK
CHAMBERLAIN
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
AMBERLAIN. As far as I see, all the good our English
  SANDYS. 
5
KING
NORFOLK
CHAMBERLAIN
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NDYS. They have all new legs, and lame ones. One would take it,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
5
KING
NORFOLK
CHAMBERLAIN
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
AMBERLAIN. Death! my lord,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
6
KING
NORFOLK
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. Death! my lord,
    Their clothes are after such a pagan cut to't,
    That sure th' have worn out Christendom.
  LOVELL. 
6
KING
NORFOLK
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CHAMBERLAIN
VELL. Faith, my lord,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
6
KING
NORFOLK
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. What is't for?
  LOVELL. 
6
KING
NORFOLK
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CHAMBERLAIN
VELL. The reformation of our travell'd gallants,
  CHAMBERLAIN.

  LOVELL.

  CHAMBERLAIN.

  GUILDFORD. 
8
KING
NORFOLK
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
ILDFORD. Ladies, a general welcome from his Grace
  GUILDFORD. 
8
KING
NORFOLK
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
ILDFORD. Ladies, a general welcome from his Grace
    Salutes ye all; this night he dedicates
    To fair content and you. None here, he hopes,
    In all this noble bevy, has brought with her
    One care abroad; he would have all as merry
    As, first, good company, good wine, good welcome,
    Can make good people.
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
8
KING
NORFOLK
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR

GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN

BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
LSEY. Good Lord Chamberlain,
    Go, give 'em welcome; you can speak the French tongue;
    And pray receive 'em nobly and conduct 'em
    Into our presence, where this heaven of beauty
    Shall shine at full upon them. Some attend him.
              Exit CHAMBERLAIN attended. All rise, and tables remov'd
  WOLSEY. 
9
KING
NORFOLK
WOLSEY

ANNE
GUILDFORD
LSEY. Good Lord Chamberlain,
    Go, give 'em welcome; you can speak the French tongue;
    And pray receive 'em nobly and conduct 'em
    Into our presence, where this heaven of beauty
    Shall shine at full upon them. Some attend him.
              Exit CHAMBERLAIN attended. All rise, and tables remov'd
    You have now a broken banquet, but we'll mend it.
    A good digestion to you all; and once more
    I show'r a welcome on ye; welcome all.
  CHAMBERLAIN.

9
KING
NORFOLK
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
NG. Lead in your ladies, ev'ry one. Sweet partner,
    I must not yet forsake you. Let's be merry:
    Good my Lord Cardinal, I have half a dozen healths
    To drink to these fair ladies, and a measure
    To lead 'em once again; and then let's dream
    Who's best in favour. Let the music knock it.
                                                Exeunt, with trumpets
  FIRST

BUCKINGHAM
COND GENTLEMAN. All the commons
    Hate him perniciously, and, o' my conscience,
    Wish him ten fathom deep: this Duke as much
    They love and dote on; call him bounteous Buckingham,
    The mirror of all courtesy-
  FIRST

KING
NORFOLK
WOLSEY

SURVEYOR
