  KATHARINE. 
13
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
SERVANT
GARDINER
GENTLEMAN
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
THARINE. I thank you, honest lord. Remember me
    In all humility unto his Highness;
    Say his long trouble now is passing
    Out of this world. Tell him in death I bless'd him,
    For so I will. Mine eyes grow dim. Farewell,
    My lord. Griffith, farewell. Nay, Patience,
    You must not leave me yet. I must to bed;
    Call in more women. When I am dead, good wench,
    Let me be us'd with honour; strew me over
    With maiden flowers, that all the world may know
    I was a chaste wife to my grave. Embalm me,
    Then lay me forth; although unqueen'd, yet like
    A queen, and daughter to a king, inter me.
    I can no more.                          Exeunt, leading KATHARINE
  GARDINER. 
13

GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
NG. Be of good cheer;
  KING. 
13
KING
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
SERVANT
DENNY
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
NG. Be of good cheer;
    They shall no more prevail than we give way to.
    Keep comfort to you, and this morning see
    You do appear before them; if they shall chance,
    In charging you with matters, to commit you,
    The best persuasions to the contrary
    Fail not to use, and with what vehemency
    Th' occasion shall instruct you. If entreaties
    Will render you no remedy, this ring
    Deliver them, and your appeal to us
    There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!
    He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest Mother!
    I swear he is true-hearted, and a soul
    None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,
    And do as I have bid you.
                                                         Exit CRANMER
  KING. 
13

CHAMBERLAIN
NG. Be of good cheer;
    They shall no more prevail than we give way to.
    Keep comfort to you, and this morning see
    You do appear before them; if they shall chance,
    In charging you with matters, to commit you,
    The best persuasions to the contrary
    Fail not to use, and with what vehemency
    Th' occasion shall instruct you. If entreaties
    Will render you no remedy, this ring
    Deliver them, and your appeal to us
    There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!
    He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest Mother!
    I swear he is true-hearted, and a soul
    None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,
    And do as I have bid you.
                                                         Exit CRANMER
    He has strangled his language in his tears.
  GENTLEMAN.

15
KING
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
SERVANT
DENNY
GENTLEMAN
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
CRANMER
D LADY. An hundred marks? By this light, I'll ha' more!
    An ordinary groom is for such payment.
    I will have more, or scold it out of him.
    Said I for this the girl was like to him! I'll
    Have more, or else unsay't; and now, while 'tis hot,
    I'll put it to the issue.                                  Exeunt
  CRANMER.

  CRANMER.

CHAMBERLAIN
CRANMER
ANMER. I hope I am not too late; and yet the gentleman
    That was sent to me from the Council pray'd me
    To make great haste. All fast? What means this? Ho!
    Who waits there? Sure you know me?
  KEEPER.

17
KING
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
BUTTS
SERVANT
KEEPER
DENNY
GENTLEMAN
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
CRANMER
ANMER.  [Aside]  'Tis Butts,
    The King's physician; as he pass'd along,
    How earnestly he cast his eyes upon me!
    Pray heaven he sound not my disgrace! For certain,
    This is of purpose laid by some that hate me-
    God turn their hearts! I never sought their malice-
    To quench mine honour; they would shame to make me
    Wait else at door, a fellow councillor,
    'Mong boys, grooms, and lackeys. But their pleasures
    Must be fulfill'd, and I attend with patience.
  BUTTS.

18
KING
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
BUTTS
SERVANT
KEEPER
DENNY
GENTLEMAN
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
CHANCELLOR
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
CRANMER
NG. Ha, 'tis he indeed.
    Is this the honour they do one another?
    'Tis well there's one above 'em yet. I had thought
    They had parted so much honesty among 'em-
    At least good manners-as not thus to suffer
    A man of his place, and so near our favour,
    To dance attendance on their lordships' pleasures,
    And at the door too, like a post with packets.
    By holy Mary, Butts, there's knavery!
    Let 'em alone, and draw the curtain close;
    We shall hear more anon.                                   Exeunt
  CHANCELLOR.

OMWELL. My mind gave me,
    In seeking tales and informations
    Against this man-whose honesty the devil
    And his disciples only envy at-
    Ye blew the fire that burns ye. Now have at ye!
  GARDINER.

CROMWELL
PORTER
NORFOLK
CHANCELLOR
SURVEYOR
KEEPER
BRANDON
LOVELL
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
GUILDFORD
NG. Good man, those joyful tears show thy true heart.
    The common voice, I see, is verified
    Of thee, which says thus: 'Do my Lord of Canterbury
    A shrewd turn and he's your friend for ever.'
    Come, lords, we trifle time away; I long
    To have this young one made a Christian.
    As I have made ye one, lords, one remain;
    So I grow stronger, you more honour gain.                  Exeunt
  PORTER.

KATHARINE
GUILDFORD
RTER. These are the youths that thunder at a playhouse
    and fight for bitten apples; that no audience but the tribulation
    of Tower-hill or the limbs of Limehouse, their dear
    brothers, are able to endure. I have some of 'em in Limbo
    Patrum, and there they are like to dance these three days;
    besides the running banquet of two beadles that is to come.
  CHAMBERLAIN.

1
NORFOLK
TIENCE, woman to Queen Katharine
       Shows; Women attending upon the Queen; Scribes,
       Officers, Guards, and other Attendants; Spirits
                          SCENE:
              London; Westminster; Kimbolton
                 KING HENRY THE EIGHTH
                     THE PROLOGUE.
    I come no more to make you laugh; things now
    That bear a weighty and a serious brow,
    Sad, high, and working, full of state and woe,
    Such noble scenes as draw the eye to flow,
    We now present. Those that can pity here
    May, if they think it well, let fall a tear:
    The subject will deserve it. Such as give
    Their money out of hope they may believe
    May here find truth too. Those that come to see
    Only a show or two, and so agree
    The play may pass, if they be still and willing,
    I'll undertake may see away their shilling
    Richly in two short hours. Only they
    That come to hear a merry bawdy play,
    A noise of targets, or to see a fellow
    In a long motley coat guarded with yellow,
    Will be deceiv'd; for, gentle hearers, know,
    To rank our chosen truth with such a show
    As fool and fight is, beside forfeiting
    Our own brains, and the opinion that we bring
    To make that only true we now intend,
    Will leave us never an understanding friend.
    Therefore, for goodness sake, and as you are known
    The first and happiest hearers of the town,
    Be sad, as we would make ye. Think ye see
    The very persons of our noble story
    As they were living; think you see them great,
    And follow'd with the general throng and sweat
    Of thousand friends; then, in a moment, see
    How soon this mightiness meets misery.
    And if you can be merry then, I'll say
    A man may weep upon his wedding-day.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Good morrow, and well met. How have ye done
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. I thank your Grace,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. An untimely ague
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. 'Twixt Guynes and Arde-
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. All the whole time
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Then you lost
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. O, you go far!
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. As I belong to worship, and affect
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Who did guide-
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. One, certes, that promises no element
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. I pray you, who, my lord?
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. All this was ord'red by the good discretion
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. The devil speed him! No man's pie is freed
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Surely, sir,
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. I cannot tell
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Why the devil,
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. I do know
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. O, many
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Grievingly I think
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Every man,
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Which is budded out;
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. Is it therefore
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Marry, is't.
  ABERGAVENNY. 
1
NORFOLK
ERGAVENNY. A proper tide of a peace, and purchas'd
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Why, all this business
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Like it your Grace,
  NORFOLK.

WOLSEY
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Like it your Grace,
    The state takes notice of the private difference
    Betwixt you and the Cardinal. I advise you-
    And take it from a heart that wishes towards you
    Honour and plenteous safety-that you read
    The Cardinal's malice and his potency
    Together; to consider further, that
    What his high hatred would effect wants not
    A minister in his power. You know his nature,
    That he's revengeful; and I know his sword
    Hath a sharp edge-it's long and't may be said
    It reaches far, and where 'twill not extend,
    Thither he darts it. Bosom up my counsel
    You'll find it wholesome. Lo, where comes that rock
    That I advise your shunning.
  WOLSEY. 
2
WOLSEY
NORFOLK
LSEY. The Duke of Buckingham's surveyor? Ha!
  SECRETARY. 
2
WOLSEY
NORFOLK
CRETARY. Here, so please you.
  WOLSEY. 
2
WOLSEY
NORFOLK
LSEY. Is he in person ready?
  SECRETARY. 
2
WOLSEY
NORFOLK
CRETARY. Ay, please your Grace.
  WOLSEY. 
2
WOLSEY
NORFOLK
LSEY. Well, we shall then know more, and Buckingham
  WOLSEY. 
1
NORFOLK
LSEY. Well, we shall then know more, and Buckingham
    shall lessen this big look.
                                          Exeunt WOLSEY and his train
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. This butcher's cur is venom-mouth'd, and I
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. What, are you chaf'd?
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. I read in's looks
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Stay, my lord,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. I'll to the King,
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Be advis'd:
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Sir,
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Say not treasonous.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. To th' King I'll say't, and make my vouch as strong
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. Faith, and so it did.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. Pray, give me favour, sir; this cunning cardinal
  NORFOLK. 
1
NORFOLK
RFOLK. I am sorry
  BUCKINGHAM. 
1
NORFOLK
CKINGHAM. No, not a syllable:
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. No, not a syllable:
    I do pronounce him in that very shape
    He shall appear in proof.
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. Your office, sergeant: execute it.
  SERGEANT. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
RGEANT. Sir,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. Lo you, my lord,
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. I am sorry
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. It will help nothing
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. Nay, he must bear you company.
  ABERGAVENNY. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ERGAVENNY. As the Duke said,
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. Here is warrant from
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. So, so!
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. A monk o' th' Chartreux.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. O, Nicholas Hopkins?
  BRANDON. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
ANDON. He.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
2
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. My surveyor is false. The o'er-great Cardinal
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
CKINGHAM. My surveyor is false. The o'er-great Cardinal
    Hath show'd him gold; my life is spann'd already.
    I am the shadow of poor Buckingham,
    Whose figure even this instant cloud puts on
    By dark'ning my clear sun. My lord, farewell.
    Exeunt
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. My life itself, and the best heart of it,
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. My life itself, and the best heart of it,
    Thanks you for this great care; I stood i' th' level
    Of a full-charg'd confederacy, and give thanks
    To you that chok'd it. Let be call'd before us
    That gentleman of Buckingham's. In person
    I'll hear his confessions justify;
    And point by point the treasons of his master
    He shall again relate.
      A noise within, crying 'Room for the Queen!'
  QUEEN 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. Nay, we must longer kneel: I am suitor.
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. Arise, and take place by us. Half your suit
  QUEEN 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. Thank your Majesty.
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. Lady mine, proceed.
  QUEEN 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. I am solicited, not by a few,
  NORFOLK. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
RFOLK. Not almost appears-
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. Taxation!
  WOLSEY. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
LSEY. Please you, sir,
  QUEEN

NORFOLK

  KING.

NG. Still exaction!
  QUEEN

NORFOLK

  KING.

NG. By my life,
  WOLSEY.

BRANDON
LSEY. And for me,
  KING. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
NG. Things done well
  WOLSEY. 
3
KING
NORFOLK
BRANDON
LSEY. [Aside to the SECRETARY]  A word with you.
  WOLSEY. 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
LSEY. [Aside to the SECRETARY]  A word with you.
    Let there be letters writ to every shire
    Of the King's grace and pardon. The grieved commons
    Hardly conceive of me-let it be nois'd
    That through our intercession this revokement
    And pardon comes. I shall anon advise you
    Further in the proceeding.                         Exit SECRETARY
  QUEEN 
4
KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
EEN KATHARINE. I am sorry that the Duke of Buckingham
  KING.

NORFOLK
SURVEYOR

NG. It grieves many.
  WOLSEY.

KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
LSEY. Stand forth, and with bold spirit relate what you,
  KING.

KING
NORFOLK
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. Speak freely.
  SURVEYOR.

  KING. 
5
KING
NORFOLK
CHAMBERLAIN
SURVEYOR
BRANDON
NG. There's his period,
    To sheath his knife in us. He is attach'd;
    Call him to present trial. If he may
    Find mercy in the law, 'tis his; if none,
    Let him not seek't of us. By day and night!
    He's traitor to th' height.                                Exeunt
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
5
KING
NORFOLK
CHAMBERLAIN

  SANDYS.

8
KING
NORFOLK
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
ILDFORD. Ladies, a general welcome from his Grace
    Salutes ye all; this night he dedicates
    To fair content and you. None here, he hopes,
    In all this noble bevy, has brought with her
    One care abroad; he would have all as merry
    As, first, good company, good wine, good welcome,
    Can make good people.
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
8
KING
NORFOLK

ANNE
GUILDFORD
LSEY. Good Lord Chamberlain,
    Go, give 'em welcome; you can speak the French tongue;
    And pray receive 'em nobly and conduct 'em
    Into our presence, where this heaven of beauty
    Shall shine at full upon them. Some attend him.
              Exit CHAMBERLAIN attended. All rise, and tables remov'd
  WOLSEY. 
9
KING
NORFOLK
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL

SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
LSEY. Good Lord Chamberlain,
    Go, give 'em welcome; you can speak the French tongue;
    And pray receive 'em nobly and conduct 'em
    Into our presence, where this heaven of beauty
    Shall shine at full upon them. Some attend him.
              Exit CHAMBERLAIN attended. All rise, and tables remov'd
    You have now a broken banquet, but we'll mend it.
    A good digestion to you all; and once more
    I show'r a welcome on ye; welcome all.
  CHAMBERLAIN.

GUILDFORD
NG. Lead in your ladies, ev'ry one. Sweet partner,
    I must not yet forsake you. Let's be merry:
    Good my Lord Cardinal, I have half a dozen healths
    To drink to these fair ladies, and a measure
    To lead 'em once again; and then let's dream
    Who's best in favour. Let the music knock it.
                                                Exeunt, with trumpets

BUCKINGHAM
COND GENTLEMAN. All the commons
    Hate him perniciously, and, o' my conscience,
    Wish him ten fathom deep: this Duke as much
    They love and dote on; call him bounteous Buckingham,
    The mirror of all courtesy-
  FIRST

10
KING
NORFOLK
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
BUCKINGHAM
CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
9
KING
NORFOLK
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
    Let it alone; my state now will but mock me.
    When I came hither I was Lord High Constable
    And Duke of Buckingham; now, poor Edward Bohun.
    Yet I am richer than my base accusers
    That never knew what truth meant; I now seal it;
    And with that blood will make 'em one day groan fort.
    My noble father, Henry of Buckingham,
    Who first rais'd head against usurping Richard,
    Flying for succour to his servant Banister,
    Being distress'd, was by that wretch betray'd
    And without trial fell; God's peace be with him!
    Henry the Seventh succeeding, truly pitying
    My father's loss, like a most royal prince,
    Restor'd me to my honours, and out of ruins
    Made my name once more noble. Now his son,
    Henry the Eighth, life, honour, name, and all
    That made me happy, at one stroke has taken
    For ever from the world. I had my trial,
    And must needs say a noble one; which makes me
    A little happier than my wretched father;
    Yet thus far we are one in fortunes: both
    Fell by our servants, by those men we lov'd most-
    A most unnatural and faithless service.
    Heaven has an end in all. Yet, you that hear me,
    This from a dying man receive as certain:
    Where you are liberal of your loves and counsels,
    Be sure you be not loose; for those you make friends
    And give your hearts to, when they once perceive
    The least rub in your fortunes, fall away
    Like water from ye, never found again
    But where they mean to sink ye. All good people,
    Pray for me! I must now forsake ye; the last hour
    Of my long weary life is come upon me.
    Farewell;
    And when you would say something that is sad,
    Speak how I fell. I have done; and God forgive me!
                                          Exeunt BUCKINGHAM and train
  FIRST

10
KING
NORFOLK
WOLSEY

CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. 'My lord,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
10
KING
NORFOLK
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
AMBERLAIN. 'My lord,
    'The horses your lordship sent for, with all the care
    had, I saw well chosen, ridden, and furnish'd. They were
    young and handsome, and of the best breed in the north.
    When they were ready to set out for London, a man of
    my Lord Cardinal's, by commission, and main power, took
    'em from me, with this reason: his master would be serv'd
    before a subject, if not before the King; which stopp'd
    our mouths, sir.'
    I fear he will indeed. Well, let him have them.
    He will have all, I think.
  NORFOLK. 
10

NORFOLK

WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. I know your Majesty has always lov'd her
  KING. 
9
KING
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
NG. Ay, and the best she shall have; and my favour
  KING. 
9
KING
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
NG. Ay, and the best she shall have; and my favour
    To him that does best. God forbid else. Cardinal,
    Prithee call Gardiner to me, my new secretary;
    I find him a fit fellow.                              Exit WOLSEY
  WOLSEY. 
9
KING
WOLSEY

CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY.  [Aside to GARDINER]  Give me your hand: much
  GARDINER.

  KING.

                                                        Exit GARDINER
    The most convenient place that I can think of
    For such receipt of learning is Blackfriars;
    There ye shall meet about this weighty business-
    My Wolsey, see it furnish'd. O, my lord,
    Would it not grieve an able man to leave
    So sweet a bedfellow? But, conscience, conscience!
    O, 'tis a tender place! and I must leave her.              Exeunt
  ANNE.

ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
D LADY. In faith, for little England
    You'd venture an emballing. I myself
    Would for Carnarvonshire, although there long'd
    No more to th' crown but that. Lo, who comes here?
  CHAMBERLAIN.

EEN KATHARINE. What need you note it? Pray you keep your way;
  QUEEN 
9
KING
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
EEN KATHARINE. What need you note it? Pray you keep your way;
    When you are call'd, return. Now the Lord help!
    They vex me past my patience. Pray you pass on.
    I will not tarry; no, nor ever more
    Upon this business my appearance make
    In any of their courts.           Exeunt QUEEN and her attendants
  KING.

9
KING
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
NG.  [Aside]  I may perceive
    These cardinals trifle with me. I abhor
    This dilatory sloth and tricks of Rome.
    My learn'd and well-beloved servant, Cranmer,
    Prithee return. With thy approach I know
    My comfort comes along. -Break up the court;
    I say, set on.                   Exuent in manner as they entered
  QUEEN 
9
KING
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
EEN KATHARINE. Take thy lute, wench. My soul grows
  QUEEN 
10
KING
WOLSEY
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
EEN KATHARINE. Take thy lute, wench. My soul grows
      sad with troubles;
    Sing and disperse 'em, if thou canst. Leave working.
                    SONG
        Orpheus with his lute made trees,
        And the mountain tops that freeze,
          Bow themselves when he did sing;
        To his music plants and flowers
        Ever sprung, as sun and showers
          There had made a lasting spring.
        Every thing that heard him play,
        Even the billows of the sea,
          Hung their heads and then lay by.
        In sweet music is such art,
        Killing care and grief of heart
          Fall asleep or hearing die.
  QUEEN 
10
KING
WOLSEY
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN

EEN KATHARINE. Pray their Graces
    To come near. [Exit GENTLEMAN] What can be their business
  QUEEN 
9
KING
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
EEN KATHARINE. Pray their Graces
    To come near. [Exit GENTLEMAN] What can be their business
    With me, a poor weak woman, fall'n from favour?
    I do not like their coming. Now I think on't,
    They should be good men, their affairs as righteous;
    But all hoods make not monks.
  WOLSEY. 
9
KING
WOLSEY

10
KING
NORFOLK
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
EEN KATHARINE. Do what ye will my lords; and pray
      forgive me
    If I have us'd myself unmannerly;
    You know I am a woman, lacking wit
    To make a seemly answer to such persons.
    Pray do my service to his Majesty;
    He has my heart yet, and shall have my prayers
    While I shall have my life. Come, reverend fathers,
    Bestow your counsels on me; she now begs
    That little thought, when she set footing here,
    She should have bought her dignities so dear.              Exeunt
  NORFOLK.

NORFOLK
WOLSEY
SERVANT

BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
NG. 'Tis nobly spoken.
    Take notice, lords, he has a loyal breast,
    For you have seen him open 't. Read o'er this;
                                                  [Giving him papers]
    And after, this; and then to breakfast with
    What appetite you have.
                Exit the KING, frowning upon the CARDINAL; the NOBLES
  WOLSEY. 
9
NORFOLK
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. What should this mean?
  WOLSEY. 
9
NORFOLK
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. What should this mean?
    What sudden anger's this? How have I reap'd it?
    He parted frowning from me, as if ruin
    Leap'd from his eyes; so looks the chafed lion
    Upon the daring huntsman that has gall'd him-
    Then makes him nothing. I must read this paper;
    I fear, the story of his anger. 'Tis so;
    This paper has undone me. 'Tis th' account
    Of all that world of wealth I have drawn together
    For mine own ends; indeed to gain the popedom,
    And fee my friends in Rome. O negligence,
    Fit for a fool to fall by! What cross devil
    Made me put this main secret in the packet
    I sent the King? Is there no way to cure this?
    No new device to beat this from his brains?
    I know 'twill stir him strongly; yet I know
    A way, if it take right, in spite of fortune,
    Will bring me off again. What's this? 'To th' Pope.'
    The letter, as I live, with all the business
    I writ to's Holiness. Nay then, farewell!
    I have touch'd the highest point of all my greatness,
    And from that full meridian of my glory
    I haste now to my setting. I shall fall
    Like a bright exhalation in the evening,
    And no man see me more.
  NORFOLK. 
9
NORFOLK
WOLSEY
SERVANT
LOVELL

SURVEYOR

8
NORFOLK
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
RFOLK. And so we'll leave you to your meditations
    How to live better. For your stubborn answer
    About the giving back the great seal to us,
    The King shall know it, and, no doubt, shall thank you.
    So fare you well, my little good Lord Cardinal.
                                                Exeunt all but WOLSEY
  WOLSEY. 
8
NORFOLK
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. So farewell to the little good you bear me.
  WOLSEY. 
9
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
SERVANT
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
LSEY. So farewell to the little good you bear me.
    Farewell, a long farewell, to all my greatness!
    This is the state of man: to-day he puts forth
    The tender leaves of hopes; to-morrow blossoms
    And bears his blushing honours thick upon him;
    The third day comes a frost, a killing frost,
    And when he thinks, good easy man, full surely
    His greatness is a-ripening, nips his root,
    And then he falls, as I do. I have ventur'd,
    Like little wanton boys that swim on bladders,
    This many summers in a sea of glory;
    But far beyond my depth. My high-blown pride
    At length broke under me, and now has left me,
    Weary and old with service, to the mercy
    Of a rude stream, that must for ever hide me.
    Vain pomp and glory of this world, I hate ye;
    I feel my heart new open'd. O, how wretched
    Is that poor man that hangs on princes' favours!
    There is betwixt that smile we would aspire to,
    That sweet aspect of princes, and their ruin
    More pangs and fears than wars or women have;
    And when he falls, he falls like Lucifer,
    Never to hope again.
  CROMWELL. 
9

  KATHARINE. 
13
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
SERVANT
GARDINER
GENTLEMAN
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
THARINE. I thank you, honest lord. Remember me
    In all humility unto his Highness;
    Say his long trouble now is passing
    Out of this world. Tell him in death I bless'd him,
    For so I will. Mine eyes grow dim. Farewell,
    My lord. Griffith, farewell. Nay, Patience,
    You must not leave me yet. I must to bed;
    Call in more women. When I am dead, good wench,
    Let me be us'd with honour; strew me over
    With maiden flowers, that all the world may know
    I was a chaste wife to my grave. Embalm me,
    Then lay me forth; although unqueen'd, yet like
    A queen, and daughter to a king, inter me.
    I can no more.                          Exeunt, leading KATHARINE
  GARDINER.

  KING. 
13
KING
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
SERVANT
DENNY
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
NG. Be of good cheer;
    They shall no more prevail than we give way to.
    Keep comfort to you, and this morning see
    You do appear before them; if they shall chance,
    In charging you with matters, to commit you,
    The best persuasions to the contrary
    Fail not to use, and with what vehemency
    Th' occasion shall instruct you. If entreaties
    Will render you no remedy, this ring
    Deliver them, and your appeal to us
    There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!
    He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest Mother!
    I swear he is true-hearted, and a soul
    None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,
    And do as I have bid you.
                                                         Exit CRANMER
  KING. 
13
KING
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
SERVANT
DENNY
GENTLEMAN
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
NG. Be of good cheer;
    They shall no more prevail than we give way to.
    Keep comfort to you, and this morning see
    You do appear before them; if they shall chance,
    In charging you with matters, to commit you,
    The best persuasions to the contrary
    Fail not to use, and with what vehemency
    Th' occasion shall instruct you. If entreaties
    Will render you no remedy, this ring
    Deliver them, and your appeal to us
    There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!
    He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest Mother!
    I swear he is true-hearted, and a soul
    None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,
    And do as I have bid you.
                                                         Exit CRANMER
    He has strangled his language in his tears.
  GENTLEMAN.

  OLD 
15
KING
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
SERVANT
DENNY
GENTLEMAN
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
CRANMER
D LADY. An hundred marks? By this light, I'll ha' more!
    An ordinary groom is for such payment.
    I will have more, or scold it out of him.
    Said I for this the girl was like to him! I'll
    Have more, or else unsay't; and now, while 'tis hot,
    I'll put it to the issue.                                  Exeunt
  CRANMER. 
15

CROMWELL

CHAMBERLAIN
CRANMER
ANMER. I hope I am not too late; and yet the gentleman
  CRANMER.

KING
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
SERVANT
KEEPER
DENNY
GENTLEMAN
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
CRANMER
ANMER. I hope I am not too late; and yet the gentleman
    That was sent to me from the Council pray'd me
    To make great haste. All fast? What means this? Ho!
    Who waits there? Sure you know me?
  KEEPER. 
16

17
KING
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
BUTTS
SERVANT
KEEPER
DENNY
GENTLEMAN
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
CRANMER
ANMER.  [Aside]  'Tis Butts,
    The King's physician; as he pass'd along,
    How earnestly he cast his eyes upon me!
    Pray heaven he sound not my disgrace! For certain,
    This is of purpose laid by some that hate me-
    God turn their hearts! I never sought their malice-
    To quench mine honour; they would shame to make me
    Wait else at door, a fellow councillor,
    'Mong boys, grooms, and lackeys. But their pleasures
    Must be fulfill'd, and I attend with patience.
  BUTTS.

18
KING
CROMWELL
NORFOLK
BUTTS
SERVANT
KEEPER
DENNY
GENTLEMAN
LOVELL
BRANDON
SURVEYOR
CAPUCIUS
CHANCELLOR
KATHARINE
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CHAMBERLAIN
CRANMER
NG. Ha, 'tis he indeed.
    Is this the honour they do one another?
    'Tis well there's one above 'em yet. I had thought
    They had parted so much honesty among 'em-
    At least good manners-as not thus to suffer
    A man of his place, and so near our favour,
    To dance attendance on their lordships' pleasures,
    And at the door too, like a post with packets.
    By holy Mary, Butts, there's knavery!
    Let 'em alone, and draw the curtain close;
    We shall hear more anon.                                   Exeunt
  CHANCELLOR.

OMWELL. My mind gave me,
    In seeking tales and informations
    Against this man-whose honesty the devil
    And his disciples only envy at-
    Ye blew the fire that burns ye. Now have at ye!
  GARDINER.

NG. Good man, those joyful tears show thy true heart.
  KING. 
19
SERVANT
GENTLEMAN
DENNY
CHAMBERLAIN
KING
BUTTS
CRANMER
ANNE
CROMWELL
PORTER
NORFOLK
CHANCELLOR
SURVEYOR
KEEPER
BRANDON
LOVELL
CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
GUILDFORD
NG. Good man, those joyful tears show thy true heart.
    The common voice, I see, is verified
    Of thee, which says thus: 'Do my Lord of Canterbury
    A shrewd turn and he's your friend for ever.'
    Come, lords, we trifle time away; I long
    To have this young one made a Christian.
    As I have made ye one, lords, one remain;
    So I grow stronger, you more honour gain.                  Exeunt
  PORTER.

CAPUCIUS
KATHARINE
GUILDFORD
RTER. These are the youths that thunder at a playhouse
    and fight for bitten apples; that no audience but the tribulation
    of Tower-hill or the limbs of Limehouse, their dear
    brothers, are able to endure. I have some of 'em in Limbo
    Patrum, and there they are like to dance these three days;
    besides the running banquet of two beadles that is to come.
  CHAMBERLAIN.

  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. Good morrow, and well met. How have ye done
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. I thank your Grace,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. An untimely ague
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. 'Twixt Guynes and Arde-
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. All the whole time
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Then you lost
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. O, you go far!
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. As I belong to worship, and affect
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. Who did guide-
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. One, certes, that promises no element
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. I pray you, who, my lord?
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. All this was ord'red by the good discretion
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. The devil speed him! No man's pie is freed
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Surely, sir,
  ABERGAVENNY. 
0
ERGAVENNY. I cannot tell
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. Why the devil,
  ABERGAVENNY. 
0
ERGAVENNY. I do know
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. O, many
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Grievingly I think
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. Every man,
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Which is budded out;
  ABERGAVENNY. 
0
ERGAVENNY. Is it therefore
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Marry, is't.
  ABERGAVENNY. 
0
ERGAVENNY. A proper tide of a peace, and purchas'd
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. Why, all this business
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Like it your Grace,
  WOLSEY. 
0
LSEY. The Duke of Buckingham's surveyor? Ha!
  SECRETARY. 
0
CRETARY. Here, so please you.
  WOLSEY. 
0
LSEY. Is he in person ready?
  SECRETARY. 
0
CRETARY. Ay, please your Grace.
  WOLSEY. 
0
LSEY. Well, we shall then know more, and Buckingham
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. This butcher's cur is venom-mouth'd, and I
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. What, are you chaf'd?
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. I read in's looks
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Stay, my lord,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. I'll to the King,
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Be advis'd:
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. Sir,
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Say not treasonous.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. To th' King I'll say't, and make my vouch as strong
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Faith, and so it did.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. Pray, give me favour, sir; this cunning cardinal
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. I am sorry
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. No, not a syllable:
  BRANDON. 
0
ANDON. Your office, sergeant: execute it.
  SERGEANT. 
0
RGEANT. Sir,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. Lo you, my lord,
  BRANDON. 
0
ANDON. I am sorry
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. It will help nothing
  BRANDON. 
0
ANDON. Nay, he must bear you company.
  ABERGAVENNY. 
0
ERGAVENNY. As the Duke said,
  BRANDON. 
0
ANDON. Here is warrant from
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. So, so!
  BRANDON. 
0
ANDON. A monk o' th' Chartreux.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. O, Nicholas Hopkins?
  BRANDON. 
0
ANDON. He.
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. My surveyor is false. The o'er-great Cardinal
  KING. 
0
NG. My life itself, and the best heart of it,
  QUEEN 
0
EEN KATHARINE. Nay, we must longer kneel: I am suitor.
  KING. 
0
NG. Arise, and take place by us. Half your suit
  QUEEN 
0
EEN KATHARINE. Thank your Majesty.
  KING. 
0
NG. Lady mine, proceed.
  QUEEN 
0
EEN KATHARINE. I am solicited, not by a few,
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Not almost appears-
  KING. 
0
NG. Taxation!
  WOLSEY. 
0
LSEY. Please you, sir,
  QUEEN 
0
EEN KATHARINE. No, my lord!
  KING. 
0
NG. Still exaction!
  QUEEN 
0
EEN KATHARINE. I am much too venturous
  KING. 
0
NG. By my life,
  WOLSEY. 
0
LSEY. And for me,
  KING. 
0
NG. Things done well
  WOLSEY. 
0
LSEY. [Aside to the SECRETARY]  A word with you.
  QUEEN 
0
EEN KATHARINE. I am sorry that the Duke of Buckingham
  KING. 
0
NG. It grieves many.
  WOLSEY. 
0
LSEY. Stand forth, and with bold spirit relate what you,
  KING. 
0
NG. Speak freely.
  SURVEYOR. 
0
RVEYOR. First, it was usual with him-every day
  WOLSEY. 
0
LSEY. Please your Highness, note
  QUEEN 
0
EEN KATHARINE. My learn'd Lord Cardinal,
  KING. 
0
NG. Speak on.
  SURVEYOR. 
0
RVEYOR. He was brought to this
  KING. 
0
NG. What was that Henton?
  SURVEYOR. 
0
RVEYOR. Sir, a Chartreux friar,
  KING. 
0
NG. How know'st thou this?
  SURVEYOR. 
0
RVEYOR. Not long before your Highness sped to France,
  QUEEN 
0
EEN KATHARINE. If I know you well,
  KING. 
0
NG. Let him on.
  SURVEYOR. 
0
RVEYOR. On my soul, I'll speak but truth.
  KING. 
0
NG. Ha! what, so rank? Ah ha!
  SURVEYOR. 
0
RVEYOR. I can, my liege.
  KING. 
0
NG. Proceed.
  SURVEYOR. 
0
RVEYOR. Being at Greenwich,
  KING. 
0
NG. I remember
  SURVEYOR. 
0
RVEYOR. 'If' quoth he 'I for this had been committed-
  KING. 
0
NG. A giant traitor!
  WOLSEY. 
0
LSEY. Now, madam, may his Highness live in freedom,
  QUEEN 
0
EEN KATHARINE. God mend all!
  KING. 
0
NG. There's something more would out of thee: what say'st?
  SURVEYOR. 
0
RVEYOR. After 'the Duke his father' with the 'knife,'
  KING. 
0
NG. There's his period,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. Is't possible the spells of France should juggle
  SANDYS. 
0
NDYS. New customs,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. As far as I see, all the good our English
  SANDYS. 
0
NDYS. They have all new legs, and lame ones. One would take it,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. Death! my lord,
  LOVELL. 
0
VELL. Faith, my lord,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. What is't for?
  LOVELL. 
0
VELL. The reformation of our travell'd gallants,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. I am glad 'tis there. Now I would pray our monsieurs
  LOVELL. 
0
VELL. They must either,
  SANDYS. 
0
NDYS. 'Tis time to give 'em physic, their diseases
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. What a loss our ladies
  LOVELL. 
0
VELL. Ay, marry,
  SANDYS. 
0
NDYS. The devil fiddle 'em! I am glad they are going,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. Well said, Lord Sandys;
  SANDYS. 
0
NDYS. No, my lord,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. Sir Thomas,
  LOVELL. 
0
VELL. To the Cardinal's;
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. O, 'tis true;
  LOVELL. 
0
VELL. That churchman bears a bounteous mind indeed,
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. No doubt he's noble;
  SANDYS. 
0
NDYS. He may, my lord; has wherewithal. In him
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. True, they are so;
  SANDYS. 
0
NDYS. I am your lordship's.                                Exeunt
  GUILDFORD. 
0
ILDFORD. Ladies, a general welcome from his Grace
  CHAMBERLAIN. 
0
AMBERLAIN. You are young, Sir Harry Guildford.
  SANDYS. 
0
NDYS. Sir Thomas Lovell, had the Cardinal

  LOVELL.

  BUCKINGHAM.

GUILDFORD

  LOVELL. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
VELL. To th' water side I must conduct your Grace;
  VAUX. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
UX. Prepare there;
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
    Let it alone; my state now will but mock me.
    When I came hither I was Lord High Constable
    And Duke of Buckingham; now, poor Edward Bohun.
    Yet I am richer than my base accusers
    That never knew what truth meant; I now seal it;
    And with that blood will make 'em one day groan fort.
    My noble father, Henry of Buckingham,
    Who first rais'd head against usurping Richard,
    Flying for succour to his servant Banister,
    Being distress'd, was by that wretch betray'd
    And without trial fell; God's peace be with him!
    Henry the Seventh succeeding, truly pitying
    My father's loss, like a most royal prince,
    Restor'd me to my honours, and out of ruins
    Made my name once more noble. Now his son,
    Henry the Eighth, life, honour, name, and all
    That made me happy, at one stroke has taken
    For ever from the world. I had my trial,
    And must needs say a noble one; which makes me
    A little happier than my wretched father;
    Yet thus far we are one in fortunes: both
    Fell by our servants, by those men we lov'd most-
    A most unnatural and faithless service.
    Heaven has an end in all. Yet, you that hear me,
    This from a dying man receive as certain:
    Where you are liberal of your loves and counsels,
    Be sure you be not loose; for those you make friends
    And give your hearts to, when they once perceive
    The least rub in your fortunes, fall away
    Like water from ye, never found again
    But where they mean to sink ye. All good people,
    Pray for me! I must now forsake ye; the last hour
    Of my long weary life is come upon me.
    Farewell;
    And when you would say something that is sad,
    Speak how I fell. I have done; and God forgive me!
                                          Exeunt BUCKINGHAM and train

  QUEEN 
5
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
KING
EEN KATHARINE. What need you note it? Pray you keep your way;
    When you are call'd, return. Now the Lord help!
    They vex me past my patience. Pray you pass on.
    I will not tarry; no, nor ever more
    Upon this business my appearance make
    In any of their courts.           Exeunt QUEEN and her attendants
  KING.

4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
NG. 'Tis nobly spoken.
    Take notice, lords, he has a loyal breast,
    For you have seen him open 't. Read o'er this;
                                                  [Giving him papers]
    And after, this; and then to breakfast with
    What appetite you have.
                Exit the KING, frowning upon the CARDINAL; the NOBLES
  WOLSEY. 
4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
LSEY. What should this mean?
  WOLSEY. 
4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
LSEY. What should this mean?
    What sudden anger's this? How have I reap'd it?
    He parted frowning from me, as if ruin
    Leap'd from his eyes; so looks the chafed lion
    Upon the daring huntsman that has gall'd him-
    Then makes him nothing. I must read this paper;
    I fear, the story of his anger. 'Tis so;
    This paper has undone me. 'Tis th' account
    Of all that world of wealth I have drawn together
    For mine own ends; indeed to gain the popedom,
    And fee my friends in Rome. O negligence,
    Fit for a fool to fall by! What cross devil
    Made me put this main secret in the packet
    I sent the King? Is there no way to cure this?
    No new device to beat this from his brains?
    I know 'twill stir him strongly; yet I know
    A way, if it take right, in spite of fortune,
    Will bring me off again. What's this? 'To th' Pope.'
    The letter, as I live, with all the business
    I writ to's Holiness. Nay then, farewell!
    I have touch'd the highest point of all my greatness,
    And from that full meridian of my glory
    I haste now to my setting. I shall fall
    Like a bright exhalation in the evening,
    And no man see me more.
  NORFOLK. 
4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
RFOLK. Hear the King's pleasure, Cardinal, who commands you
  WOLSEY.

  NORFOLK.

  NORFOLK. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
RFOLK. And so we'll leave you to your meditations
    How to live better. For your stubborn answer
    About the giving back the great seal to us,
    The King shall know it, and, no doubt, shall thank you.
    So fare you well, my little good Lord Cardinal.
                                                Exeunt all but WOLSEY
  WOLSEY.

  KING.

  KING. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NG. Be of good cheer;
    They shall no more prevail than we give way to.
    Keep comfort to you, and this morning see
    You do appear before them; if they shall chance,
    In charging you with matters, to commit you,
    The best persuasions to the contrary
    Fail not to use, and with what vehemency
    Th' occasion shall instruct you. If entreaties
    Will render you no remedy, this ring
    Deliver them, and your appeal to us
    There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!
    He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest Mother!
    I swear he is true-hearted, and a soul
    None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,
    And do as I have bid you.
                                                         Exit CRANMER

CKINGHAM. Good morrow, and well met. How have ye done
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. I thank your Grace,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. An untimely ague
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. 'Twixt Guynes and Arde-
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0
CKINGHAM. All the whole time
  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. Then you lost
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0

  NORFOLK. 
0
RFOLK. As I belong to worship, and affect
  BUCKINGHAM. 
0

  NORFOLK. 
0

  BUCKINGHAM. 
0

  NORFOLK. 
0

  BUCKINGHAM.

  ABERGAVENNY.

    Go, give 'em welcome; you can speak the French tongue;

    Into our presence, where this heaven of beauty
    Shall shine at full upon them. Some attend him.
              Exit CHAMBERLAIN attended. All rise, and tables remov'd

  BUCKINGHAM. 
3

  LOVELL.

GUILDFORD
VELL. I do beseech your Grace, for charity,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CKINGHAM. Sir Thomas Lovell, I as free forgive you
  LOVELL. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
VELL. To th' water side I must conduct your Grace;
  VAUX. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
UX. Prepare there;
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
    Let it alone; my state now will but mock me.
    When I came hither I was Lord High Constable
    And Duke of Buckingham; now, poor Edward Bohun.
    Yet I am richer than my base accusers
    That never knew what truth meant; I now seal it;
    And with that blood will make 'em one day groan fort.
    My noble father, Henry of Buckingham,
    Who first rais'd head against usurping Richard,
    Flying for succour to his servant Banister,
    Being distress'd, was by that wretch betray'd
    And without trial fell; God's peace be with him!
    Henry the Seventh succeeding, truly pitying
    My father's loss, like a most royal prince,
    Restor'd me to my honours, and out of ruins
    Made my name once more noble. Now his son,
    Henry the Eighth, life, honour, name, and all
    That made me happy, at one stroke has taken
    For ever from the world. I had my trial,
    And must needs say a noble one; which makes me
    A little happier than my wretched father;
    Yet thus far we are one in fortunes: both
    Fell by our servants, by those men we lov'd most-
    A most unnatural and faithless service.
    Heaven has an end in all. Yet, you that hear me,
    This from a dying man receive as certain:
    Where you are liberal of your loves and counsels,
    Be sure you be not loose; for those you make friends
    And give your hearts to, when they once perceive
    The least rub in your fortunes, fall away
    Like water from ye, never found again
    But where they mean to sink ye. All good people,
    Pray for me! I must now forsake ye; the last hour
    Of my long weary life is come upon me.
    Farewell;
    And when you would say something that is sad,
    Speak how I fell. I have done; and God forgive me!
                                          Exeunt BUCKINGHAM and train
  FIRST

    When you are call'd, return. Now the Lord help!
    They vex me past my patience. Pray you pass on.
    I will not tarry; no, nor ever more
    Upon this business my appearance make
    In any of their courts.           Exeunt QUEEN and her attendants

4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
NG. 'Tis nobly spoken.
    Take notice, lords, he has a loyal breast,
    For you have seen him open 't. Read o'er this;
                                                  [Giving him papers]
    And after, this; and then to breakfast with
    What appetite you have.
                Exit the KING, frowning upon the CARDINAL; the NOBLES
  WOLSEY. 
4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
LSEY. What should this mean?
  WOLSEY. 
4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
LSEY. What should this mean?
    What sudden anger's this? How have I reap'd it?
    He parted frowning from me, as if ruin
    Leap'd from his eyes; so looks the chafed lion
    Upon the daring huntsman that has gall'd him-
    Then makes him nothing. I must read this paper;
    I fear, the story of his anger. 'Tis so;
    This paper has undone me. 'Tis th' account
    Of all that world of wealth I have drawn together
    For mine own ends; indeed to gain the popedom,
    And fee my friends in Rome. O negligence,
    Fit for a fool to fall by! What cross devil
    Made me put this main secret in the packet
    I sent the King? Is there no way to cure this?
    No new device to beat this from his brains?
    I know 'twill stir him strongly; yet I know
    A way, if it take right, in spite of fortune,
    Will bring me off again. What's this? 'To th' Pope.'
    The letter, as I live, with all the business
    I writ to's Holiness. Nay then, farewell!
    I have touch'd the highest point of all my greatness,
    And from that full meridian of my glory
    I haste now to my setting. I shall fall
    Like a bright exhalation in the evening,
    And no man see me more.
  NORFOLK. 
4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
RFOLK. Hear the King's pleasure, Cardinal, who commands you
  WOLSEY.

GUILDFORD
RFOLK. And so we'll leave you to your meditations
    How to live better. For your stubborn answer
    About the giving back the great seal to us,
    The King shall know it, and, no doubt, shall thank you.
    So fare you well, my little good Lord Cardinal.
                                                Exeunt all but WOLSEY

GUILDFORD
THARINE. Prithee, good Griffith, tell me how he died.
  GRIFFITH. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
IFFITH. Well, the voice goes, madam;
  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. Alas, poor man!
  GRIFFITH. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
IFFITH. At last, with easy roads, he came to Leicester,
  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. So may he rest; his faults lie gently on him!
  GRIFFITH. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
IFFITH. Noble madam,
  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. Yes, good Griffith;
  GRIFFITH. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
IFFITH. This Cardinal,
  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. After my death I wish no other herald,
  GRIFFITH. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
IFFITH. She is asleep. Good wench, let's sit down quiet,
  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. Spirits of peace, where are ye? Are ye all gone?
  GRIFFITH. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
IFFITH. Madam, we are here.
  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. It is not you I call for.
  GRIFFITH. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
IFFITH. None, madam.
  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. No? Saw you not, even now, a blessed troop
  GRIFFITH. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
IFFITH. I am most joyful, madam, such good dreams
  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. Bid the music leave,
  PATIENCE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
TIENCE. Do you note
  GRIFFITH. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
IFFITH. She is going, wench. Pray, pray.
  PATIENCE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
TIENCE. Heaven comfort her!
  MESSENGER. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
SSENGER. An't like your Grace-
  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. You are a saucy fellow.
  GRIFFITH. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
IFFITH. You are to blame,
  MESSENGER. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
SSENGER. I humbly do entreat your Highness' pardon;
  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. Admit him entrance, Griffith; but this fellow
  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. Admit him entrance, Griffith; but this fellow
    Let me ne'er see again.                            Exit MESSENGER
  CAPUCIUS. 
3

GUILDFORD

  KATHARINE.

GUILDFORD

  CAPUCIUS. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
PUCIUS. Madam, in good health.
  KATHARINE. 
3

ANNE
GUILDFORD

  PATIENCE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD

  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD

  CAPUCIUS. 
3

GUILDFORD

  KATHARINE. 
3

ANNE
GUILDFORD

  CAPUCIUS. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD

  KATHARINE. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
THARINE. I thank you, honest lord. Remember me
  GARDINER. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE

  BOY. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
Y. It hath struck.
  GARDINER. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD

  LOVELL.

ANNE
GUILDFORD

3

ANNE
GUILDFORD

  LOVELL. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
VELL. I must to him too,
  GARDINER. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
RDINER. Not yet, Sir Thomas Lovell. What's the matter?
  LOVELL. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
VELL. My lord, I love you;
  GARDINER. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
RDINER. The fruit she goes with
  LOVELL. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE

  GARDINER.

  GARDINER.

  LOVELL. 
3
SERVANT

GUILDFORD

  LOVELL.

SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
VELL. Many good nights, my lord; I rest your servant.
                                             Exeunt GARDINER and PAGE
  KING. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
NG. Charles, I will play no more to-night;
  SUFFOLK. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
FFOLK. Sir, I did never win of you before.
  KING. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
NG. But little, Charles;
  LOVELL. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
VELL. I could not personally deliver to her
  KING. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
NG. What say'st thou, ha?
  LOVELL. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD

  KING.

ANNE
GUILDFORD

  SUFFOLK.

SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
FFOLK. God safely quit her of her burden, and
  KING.

SERVANT

GUILDFORD
NG. 'Tis midnight, Charles;

  KING. 
3
SERVANT

  DENNY.

  KING.

GUILDFORD

  DENNY. 
3

  KING. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
NG. 'Tis true. Where is he, Denny?
  DENNY. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD

SERVANT

GUILDFORD

  LOVELL.

    I am happily come hither.
  KING.

  KING.

SERVANT

GUILDFORD
DENNY

    Ha! I have said. Be gone.
    What!                                     Exeunt LOVELL and DENNY
  CRANMER.

  KING.

  CRANMER.

GUILDFORD
DENNY

  KING. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NG. Know you not
  CRANMER. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
ANMER. God and your Majesty
  KING. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NG. Be of good cheer;
  KING. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NG. Be of good cheer;
    They shall no more prevail than we give way to.
    Keep comfort to you, and this morning see
    You do appear before them; if they shall chance,
    In charging you with matters, to commit you,
    The best persuasions to the contrary
    Fail not to use, and with what vehemency
    Th' occasion shall instruct you. If entreaties
    Will render you no remedy, this ring
    Deliver them, and your appeal to us
    There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!
    He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest Mother!
    I swear he is true-hearted, and a soul
    None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,
    And do as I have bid you.
                                                         Exit CRANMER
  GENTLEMAN.

  NORFOLK.

    Shall shine at full upon them. Some attend him.

  VAUX. 
3

GUILDFORD
UX. Prepare there;
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
  BUCKINGHAM. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
CKINGHAM. Nay, Sir Nicholas,
    Let it alone; my state now will but mock me.
    When I came hither I was Lord High Constable
    And Duke of Buckingham; now, poor Edward Bohun.
    Yet I am richer than my base accusers
    That never knew what truth meant; I now seal it;
    And with that blood will make 'em one day groan fort.
    My noble father, Henry of Buckingham,
    Who first rais'd head against usurping Richard,
    Flying for succour to his servant Banister,
    Being distress'd, was by that wretch betray'd
    And without trial fell; God's peace be with him!
    Henry the Seventh succeeding, truly pitying
    My father's loss, like a most royal prince,
    Restor'd me to my honours, and out of ruins
    Made my name once more noble. Now his son,
    Henry the Eighth, life, honour, name, and all
    That made me happy, at one stroke has taken
    For ever from the world. I had my trial,
    And must needs say a noble one; which makes me
    A little happier than my wretched father;
    Yet thus far we are one in fortunes: both
    Fell by our servants, by those men we lov'd most-
    A most unnatural and faithless service.
    Heaven has an end in all. Yet, you that hear me,
    This from a dying man receive as certain:
    Where you are liberal of your loves and counsels,
    Be sure you be not loose; for those you make friends
    And give your hearts to, when they once perceive
    The least rub in your fortunes, fall away
    Like water from ye, never found again
    But where they mean to sink ye. All good people,
    Pray for me! I must now forsake ye; the last hour
    Of my long weary life is come upon me.
    Farewell;
    And when you would say something that is sad,
    Speak how I fell. I have done; and God forgive me!
                                          Exeunt BUCKINGHAM and train
  FIRST

SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
RFOLK. A gracious king that pardons all offences
  KING. 
3
SERVANT

GUILDFORD
NG. Ye are too bold.
  WOLSEY.

SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD

  KING.

GUILDFORD

  NORFOLK. 
3
SERVANT

  SUFFOLK.

GUILDFORD

  SUFFOLK.

  WOLSEY.

  KING.

  KING. 
4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
NG. Ay, and the best she shall have; and my favour
    To him that does best. God forbid else. Cardinal,
    Prithee call Gardiner to me, my new secretary;
    I find him a fit fellow.                              Exit WOLSEY

  QUEEN 
5
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
KING
EEN KATHARINE. What need you note it? Pray you keep your way;
    When you are call'd, return. Now the Lord help!
    They vex me past my patience. Pray you pass on.
    I will not tarry; no, nor ever more
    Upon this business my appearance make
    In any of their courts.           Exeunt QUEEN and her attendants

  KING. 
4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
NG. 'Tis nobly spoken.
    Take notice, lords, he has a loyal breast,
    For you have seen him open 't. Read o'er this;
                                                  [Giving him papers]
    And after, this; and then to breakfast with
    What appetite you have.
                Exit the KING, frowning upon the CARDINAL; the NOBLES
  WOLSEY. 
4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
LSEY. What should this mean?
  WOLSEY. 
4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
LSEY. What should this mean?
    What sudden anger's this? How have I reap'd it?
    He parted frowning from me, as if ruin
    Leap'd from his eyes; so looks the chafed lion
    Upon the daring huntsman that has gall'd him-
    Then makes him nothing. I must read this paper;
    I fear, the story of his anger. 'Tis so;
    This paper has undone me. 'Tis th' account
    Of all that world of wealth I have drawn together
    For mine own ends; indeed to gain the popedom,
    And fee my friends in Rome. O negligence,
    Fit for a fool to fall by! What cross devil
    Made me put this main secret in the packet
    I sent the King? Is there no way to cure this?
    No new device to beat this from his brains?
    I know 'twill stir him strongly; yet I know
    A way, if it take right, in spite of fortune,
    Will bring me off again. What's this? 'To th' Pope.'
    The letter, as I live, with all the business
    I writ to's Holiness. Nay then, farewell!
    I have touch'd the highest point of all my greatness,
    And from that full meridian of my glory
    I haste now to my setting. I shall fall
    Like a bright exhalation in the evening,
    And no man see me more.
  NORFOLK. 
4
SERVANT
WOLSEY
ANNE
GUILDFORD
RFOLK. Hear the King's pleasure, Cardinal, who commands you
  WOLSEY.

  NORFOLK. 
3
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
RFOLK. And so we'll leave you to your meditations
    How to live better. For your stubborn answer
    About the giving back the great seal to us,
    The King shall know it, and, no doubt, shall thank you.
    So fare you well, my little good Lord Cardinal.
                                                Exeunt all but WOLSEY
  WOLSEY.

ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NG. How now, my lord? You do desire to know
  CRANMER. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
ANMER.  [Kneeling]  It is my duty
  KING. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NG. Pray you, arise,
  CRANMER. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
ANMER. I humbly thank your Highness
  KING. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NG. Stand up, good Canterbury;
  CRANMER. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
ANMER. Most dread liege,
  KING. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NG. Know you not
  CRANMER. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
ANMER. God and your Majesty
  KING. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NG. Be of good cheer;
  KING. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NG. Be of good cheer;
    They shall no more prevail than we give way to.
    Keep comfort to you, and this morning see
    You do appear before them; if they shall chance,
    In charging you with matters, to commit you,
    The best persuasions to the contrary
    Fail not to use, and with what vehemency
    Th' occasion shall instruct you. If entreaties
    Will render you no remedy, this ring
    Deliver them, and your appeal to us
    There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!
    He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest Mother!
    I swear he is true-hearted, and a soul
    None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,
    And do as I have bid you.
                                                         Exit CRANMER
  GENTLEMAN. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NTLEMAN.  [Within]  Come back; what mean you?
  OLD 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
D LADY. I'll not come back; the tidings that I bring
  KING. 
4
SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
NG. Now, by thy looks
  OLD

GUILDFORD

D LADY. An hundred marks? By this light, I'll ha' more!

  KEEPER.

  BUTTS.

  CRANMER.

DENNY

  BUTTS.

ANNE

DENNY

  KING.

SERVANT
ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY

  BUTTS.

  KING.

  CROMWELL.

  MAN.

ANNE

DENNY
N. Pray, sir, be patient; 'tis as much impossible,
  PORTER.

ANNE

RTER. How got they in, and be hang'd?
  MAN.

ANNE
GUILDFORD
DENNY
N. Alas, I know not: how gets the tide in?
  PORTER.

GUILDFORD
DENNY

  MAN.

  PORTER.

  CHAMBERLAIN.

GUILDFORD
